Lore: A brutal blade favored by Noxian gladiators and those clawing for power. Each strike is a gamble; life force siphoned from the defeated, but leaving the wielder vulnerable in their greed.
DescriptionLore: This wicked-looking dagger is favored by those who seek power at any cost. When you hit a creature with this magic weapon, you can choose to gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. However, until the end of your next turn, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws.

Lore: Forged in the celestial realm of Targon, this chain echoes with the power to manipulate the flow of time. Said to be wielded by those touched by the Aspects, it can slow the advance of enemies or even safeguard against temporal unraveling.
DescriptionLore: This shimmering chain, crafted from celestial starlight, allows the wielder to manipulate the flow of time in a limited fashion. As an action, you can target one creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be slowed for 1 minute. While slowed in this way, the target's speed is halved, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. You can use this ability three times, and regain all expended uses after a long rest. Additionally, the chain grants advantage on saving throws against effects that would alter your position in the timeline or otherwise erase you from existence.

Lore: A seal pulsing with dark magic, coveted by Noxian mages seeking forbidden knowledge. It amplifies arcane power, but demands a heavy price: servitude to a lurking entity should the wearer fall.
DescriptionLore: This obsidian seal pulses with a malevolent energy. While you wear this seal, your spell attack bonus and spell save DC each increase by 1. Additionally, whenever you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points with a spell while wearing the seal, you gain 5 temporary hit points. However, if you are reduced to 0 hit points while wearing this seal, you must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or become cursed. While cursed, you are compelled to serve a dark entity, as determined by the DM, and cannot willingly act in a way that would displease it.

Lore: A simple, dependable blade found across Runeterra. Many a novice warrior has begun their journey with this weapon, its edge honed by countless practice spars.
DescriptionLore: This simple, yet effective blade grants +1 to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it. Additionally, you regain 5 hit points after reducing a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon.

Lore: A sturdy shield carried by soldiers throughout Runeterra. Its protective magic grants resilience in the face of danger, a bulwark against even the most devastating blows.
DescriptionLore: While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. In addition, as a reaction when you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a saving throw to take only half damage, you can use this shield to instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail. You can't use this reaction if you are incapacitated.

Lore: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, this hammer echoes with the fury of forgotten Iceborn warriors. It whispers of relentless battles against the Void's encroaching chill, a constant reminder of the sacrifices made to safeguard the frozen lands.
DescriptionLore: This hammer deals an extra 1d6 cold damage on a hit. Once per day, as an action, you can slam the hammer into the ground, creating a 15-foot radius circle of difficult terrain centered on you for 1 minute. Creatures starting their turn in the difficult terrain must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced by half until the end of their turn.

Lore: This orb pulses with the tranquil, yet formidable, energy of Ionian spirit magic. It is said to ward against malevolent spirits, reflecting inner peace outwards to protect the wielder from those who seek to corrupt the balance.
DescriptionLore: This orb pulses with ancient Ionian spirit magic. While holding the orb, you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can expend a charge to unleash a warding burst. All creatures within 15 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from you and be unable to move closer to you until the end of your next turn. The orb has 3 charges, and it regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: A seed imbued with the protective magic of Ixtal. When planted, it rapidly grows into a guardian, a testament to the region's deep connection to the elements and its unwavering commitment to shielding itself from the outside world.
DescriptionLore: This seedling resonates with Ixtali elemental magic. As an action, you can plant the seedling in fertile ground. Over the next 24 hours, the seedling grows into a Mosstomper plant that acts as a guardian. The Mosstomper is a Large plant with AC 15 (natural armor), 50 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, immunity to poison and psychic damage, and the following actions: Slam (Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage) and Entangling Roots (The Mosstomper targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or become restrained. A creature can use its action to make a DC 14 Strength check, freeing itself or another restrained creature within reach on a success. The plant lasts for 7 days or until destroyed.

Lore: A popular brew amongst the hardy folk of the Freljord. This icy drink, rumored to contain a secret blend of frost berries and glacier melt, fortifies the body against the biting cold and invigorates the spirit with the strength of the land.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this juice, you gain 1d6 temporary hit points. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against the effects of extreme cold for 1 hour. This icy beverage is especially popular amongst the hardy folk of the Freljord, rumored to contain a secret blend of frost berries and melted glacier ice, and is associated with the Winter's Claw tribe.

Lore: A draught favored by Noxian siege engineers and warriors. It grants immense size and resilience, a testament to Noxus's ambition for power and its willingness to push the boundaries of physical augmentation. Some whisper of the Black Rose's influence in its creation.
DescriptionLore: For 1 hour after drinking this elixir, your size increases by one category (Medium becomes Large, etc.), and you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your level. While enlarged in this way, your Strength score becomes 20. If your Strength is already 20 or higher, the elixir has no effect on this score. Once the elixir's effect ends, your size returns to normal, and any unused temporary hit points are lost. Favored by Noxian siege engineers and frontline soldiers, it's rumored that the Black Rose has a hand in the magical augmentation required to make it.

Lore: A crimson draught favored by Noxian arena combatants and warlords alike. This potent elixir fuels reckless aggression, granting a brutal edge in battle, but demands a heavy price: the imbiber risks succumbing to uncontrollable rage, turning on friend and foe alike.
DescriptionLore: Upon consuming this elixir, you gain the benefits of the *haste* spell for 1 minute. Additionally, for the duration, you have advantage on attack rolls, but at the end of each of your turns, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or attack the nearest creature (determined randomly if multiple creatures are equally near). Favored by arena combatants and bloodthirsty warlords seeking an edge in battle, the Elixir of Wrath is often used in the fighting pits of Noxus.

Lore: A simple, yet invaluable flask found throughout Runeterra. Its self-replenishing nature provides a constant source of healing, favored by adventurers and travelers braving the wilds. The source of its magic remains a mystery, whispered to be anything from ancient enchantments to forgotten Shuriman technology.
DescriptionLore: This small, unassuming flask magically refills itself with a revitalizing concoction. As an action, you can drink this potion to regain 2d4 + 2 hit points. The potion refills immediately after being emptied.

Lore: Crafted by Demacian mageseekers, the Oracle Lens pierces deception, revealing hidden threats and magical concealments. Originally designed to expose rogue mages operating in secret, its use has expanded to hunting down spies and uncovering forbidden magic, making it a crucial tool for safeguarding Demacia's borders.
DescriptionLore: This crystal lens allows you to perceive hidden threats. As an action, you can hold the lens and focus on a point within 30 feet. For the next minute, you can see any invisible or obscured creatures and objects in that area. Additionally, any magical wards or traps in the area are revealed to you, appearing as faint shimmering outlines. Once used, the lens cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Brewed in the back alleys of Bilgewater, this shimmering elixir whispers promises of riches and insight. While it sharpens the mind for negotiation and uncovers hidden motives, it also awakens a dangerous greed, tempting the imbiber to seize any valuable prize, regardless of the cost or consequence.
DescriptionLore: Upon consumption, this shimmering golden elixir bestows a touch of greed. For the next hour, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to discern the motivations of creatures, and you gain a +2 bonus to Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to bargain or negotiate. However, you also become noticeably more covetous, and must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be compelled to attempt to acquire any valuable item you see, regardless of the consequences. This effect ends if you are reduced to 0 hit points or if the elixir's duration expires.

Lore: Distilled in secluded Ionian monasteries, the Elixir of Skill unlocks latent potential, offering a fleeting glimpse of true mastery. Imbued with spiritual energy, it sharpens reflexes and heightens awareness, allowing the imbiber to push their limits and achieve momentary brilliance in combat or artistry.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this elixir, you gain the benefits of a short rest. Additionally, roll a d4. You gain a bonus equal to the number rolled on one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you make within the next hour. You can choose to apply the bonus after you roll the d20, but before the outcome is determined.

Lore: A Freljord delicacy, Poro-Snax are irresistibly delicious to the fluffy Poros of the Howling Abyss. Some believe they contain a spark of the ancient magic that permeates the ice.
DescriptionLore: As an action, you can offer a Poro-Snax to a beast of your choice that can see and hear you. The beast must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the beast will follow your simple commands and defend you. A beast charmed in this way cannot be affected by another Poro-Snax until it finishes a long rest. If no beast is in sight, consuming the snax grants you advantage on your next Animal Handling check within the next 10 minutes.

Lore: A hardy biscuit, baked with a secret recipe passed down through generations in Demacia. Soldiers prize it for its ability to restore vigor after long marches and grueling battles.
DescriptionLore: As an action, you can consume this biscuit. When you do, you regain 4d4 hit points and are cured of one level of exhaustion. The biscuit crumbles to dust after being eaten.

Lore: Forged in the unforgiving wilderness of the Freljord, these greaves are favored by warriors seeking to channel the raw power of the storm. Each step ignites a primal fury, granting unmatched strength at a perilous cost.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these greaves, your walking speed increases by 10 feet. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can enter a berserker rage. While raging in this way, you gain advantage on Strength-based attack rolls and saving throws, and you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. At the end of each of your turns while raging, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion. This rage lasts for 1 minute or until you are incapacitated. You can use this feature once, and regain its use after finishing a long rest.

Lore: Woven with enchanted threads by Ionian artisans, these boots whisper of the wind. They allow the wearer to move with unmatched speed and grace, as if guided by the spirits of the land.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 15 feet. In addition, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when moving at your normal pace.

Lore: Forged in Noxus and imbued with protective runes, Mercury's Treads offer resilience against both magic and poison. They are worn by those who face the most treacherous of adversaries, be it within the arena or on the battlefield.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these treads, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, you have resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws against being poisoned.

Lore: Crafted in the forges of Noxus, these boots are imbued with potent arcane energy, enhancing a mage's ability to channel and unleash destructive spells. Favored among the Black Rose for their deadly efficiency.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these shoes, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls. Additionally, once per long rest, when you cast a spell that deals damage, you can maximize the damage of one die roll of that spell.

Lore: Woven with spirit threads by Ionian monks, this amulet fosters a unique connection between souls. It is said to resonate most strongly during the Spirit Blossom festival, when the veil between the spirit realm and the material world thins.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this amulet, when you cast a spell targeting only one creature, you can choose a second creature within 30 feet of the first. The spell affects both creatures as if they were the original target. If the spell requires a saving throw, each target makes their own save. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: A novice mage's companion, this book is infused with the potent spirit energy of Ionia. The tome allows the wielder to enhance and hone the elemental forces within.
DescriptionLore: While holding this book, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. In addition, when you cast a spell that deals acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to one damage roll of the spell.

Lore: Forged in Ionia, this wand crackles with raw elemental power, eager to be unleashed. Legends whisper that the first wands were gifted by benevolent spirits to aid humanity.
DescriptionLore: Wand, very rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster). While holding this wand, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls. In addition, you can expend 1 charge to cast one of the following spells (save DC 17): burning hands, scorching ray, fireball. The wand has 7 charges and regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ash and is destroyed.

Lore: A staple among Demacian soldiers. While simple in design, skilled armorers and mages can imbue this armor with enchantments offering protection against specific threats.
DescriptionLore: Armor (light armor), uncommon. While wearing this armor, you have resistance to one of the following damage types (choose when you attune to the armor): bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing. Once chosen, the damage type cannot be changed. If the armor is unenchanted, it provides no AC bonus.

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks, these charms are said to resonate with the spirit realm, offering clarity and protection against unwelcome influences.
DescriptionLore: Wondrous item, rare. While you possess this charm, you gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per day, when you fail a Wisdom saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead.

Lore: A dependable weapon, the Long Sword is common across Runeterra, carried by soldiers, mercenaries, and adventurers alike. Its simple design belies its effectiveness in trained hands.
DescriptionLore: N/A

Lore: Woven with anti-magic threads by Demacian craftsfolk, this mantle offers protection against arcane assaults, a vital defense against rogue mages and the horrors of the Shadow Isles.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this mantle, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, you have resistance to force damage.

Lore: Crystals resonating with celestial energy from Mount Targon, these gems are prized by those who seek to enhance their connection to the stars and amplify their magical abilities.
DescriptionLore: While holding this crystal, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. In addition, you regain 1 additional expended spell slot when you finish a short rest. Once you use this ability, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest. This crystal crackles faintly with celestial energy.

Lore: Born from the ebb and flow of Ionian spirit magic, Aether Wisps are drawn to places of potent energy. Releasing one grants a fleeting shield against psychic intrusions.
DescriptionLore: This shimmering wisp grants advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As a bonus action, you can release the wisp, causing it to hover around you for 1 minute. While the wisp is active, you gain resistance to psychic damage. Once the wisp has been released, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Crafted in Ionia, this mirror is said to reflect the user's inner spirit, strengthening their connection to the unseen world. Some believe it to be imbued with the lingering essence of spirits guided by the Kohai order, offering glimpses into the ethereal realm.
DescriptionLore: While holding this mirror, you can cast the 'detect magic' spell at will, without expending a spell slot. Additionally, as an action, you can peer into the mirror and attempt to communicate with a spirit. Roll a d20 and add your Wisdom modifier. On a 15 or higher, you establish a brief telepathic connection with a spirit, allowing you to ask it one question. The spirit's answer is cryptic and may be unhelpful. Once used, this feature cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Forged in the crucible of Noxus, this barbed vest punishes any who dare strike the wearer. A grim reminder of the arena, it embodies the empire's brutal pragmatism and relentless pursuit of strength.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC. Additionally, whenever a creature hits you with a melee attack, the attacker takes 2 piercing damage.

Lore: A masterwork of Demacian craftsmanship, Caulfield's Warhammer is a symbol of martial excellence. Favored by both artisans and elite soldiers, its balanced design and sturdy construction inspire confidence on the battlefield and in the forge.
DescriptionLore: This warhammer grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. In addition, once per day, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to grant yourself or an ally within 30 feet of you advantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw they make before the end of their next turn.

Lore: Wrought with shards of True Ice from the Frostguard Citadel, this bracer offers resilience against the harshest elements. Legends tell of its creation by a forgotten Iceborn tribe, offering protection to those who brave the frozen wastes.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this bracer, you have resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can touch a creature and grant them 1d6 temporary hit points. You cannot use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: Gathered from the ruins of ancient Shurima, these ashes hold echoes of the Ascended. Whispers of forgotten prophecies linger within, offering glimpses into possible futures for those who dare to seek them.
DescriptionLore: While holding these ashes, you can use an action to scatter them, gaining advantage on your next Wisdom (Perception) or Wisdom (Insight) check made within the next minute as whispers of forgotten knowledge guide your senses.

Lore: Carved from jade and imbued with ancient spirit magic, the Forbidden Idol is said to ward off malevolent influences, creating a sanctuary of calm amidst chaos.
DescriptionLore: While holding this idol, you can use a bonus action to touch a creature. For the next minute, that creature gains advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Once used, the idol cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: A shield hewn from true ice, the Glacial Buckler resonates with the chilling power of the Freljord. It stands as a bulwark against physical blows, freezing attackers in their tracks.
DescriptionLore: While holding this buckler, you have resistance to bludgeoning damage from nonmagical weapons. Additionally, as a reaction when you are hit by a melee attack, you can cover the attacker in a sheet of ice; they must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced by half until the end of their next turn.

Lore: Forged in the heart of a forgotten Freljordian hunting tribe, the Hearthbound Axe urges its wielder to pursue their quarry relentlessly, its whispers echoing with the thrill of the chase.
DescriptionLore: This magical battleaxe whispers tales of the hunt. While attuned, your speed increases by 10 feet when moving towards a hostile creature you can see. Additionally, once per turn when you hit a creature with this axe, you can choose to reduce the creature's speed by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

Lore: A marvel of Piltover's Hextech ingenuity, the Alternator channels arcane energy into potent bursts of lightning, empowering its user with electrifying force. Careful calibration is crucial.
DescriptionLore: This Ionian device crackles with arcane energy. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to imbue your next weapon attack with magical energy. If that attack hits, it deals an extra 2d6 lightning damage. The alternator has 3 charges, and it regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Bearing the crimson sigil of Noxus, the Last Whisper ensures that no defense is unbreakable. It slices through armor and resolve alike, silencing any resistance to the empire's might.
DescriptionLore: This Noxian longsword hums with lethal precision. Attacks made with this weapon ignore resistance to slashing damage. Additionally, once per turn when you hit a creature with this sword, you can choose to reduce any temporary hit points the target has by an amount equal to the damage dealt.

Lore: Woven with arcane threads and imbued with protective energies, the Negatron Cloak shields its wearer from hostile magic and mental assaults. It offers a bulwark against the Void's insidious whispers and the corrupting influences of otherworldly realms, a safeguard against unwanted transformations.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this cloak, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, or possessed. Additionally, you have resistance to necrotic damage and any effect that would alter your form against your will.

Lore: A relic of the Shadow Isles, the Oblivion Orb crackles with the potent energy of undeath. It is said to contain echoes of forgotten rituals and the chilling touch of the Black Mist, capable of weakening the very essence of life and hindering the arcane arts of its victims.
DescriptionLore: This orb pulses with dark energy. As an action, you can crush the orb, unleashing a wave of necrotic energy in a 30-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 8d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. For the next minute, any creature that takes necrotic damage from you has disadvantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects. Once used, the orb crumbles to dust.

Lore: Forged with rare metals and infused with potent magic, the Quicksilver Sash grants its wearer the ability to shrug off debilitating enchantments. Whether resisting Noxian warcraft or escaping the grasp of ethereal bindings, this sash provides a vital defense against control and manipulation.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this sash, you can use a bonus action to end one effect that is causing you to be charmed, paralyzed, stunned, petrified or restrained. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Crafted by Ionian artisans with meticulous care, this recurve bow is revered for its exceptional precision and swiftness. The supple wood and carefully balanced limbs enhance the archer's focus, allowing for deadly accuracy and increased agility in the heat of battle.
DescriptionLore: This masterwork recurve bow, crafted with techniques known only in Ionia, grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. In addition, when you nock an arrow as part of the Attack action, your movement speed increases by 10 feet until the end of your turn.

Lore: Favored by the Dauntless Vanguard, this sturdy slingshot is a reliable tool for Demacian scouts venturing into the untamed wilds. With it, they track elusive foes, maintain vigilance over Demacia's borders, and sometimes, with a bit of luck, unbalance their enemies in the field.
DescriptionLore: This simple slingshot, commonly used by Demacian scouts, grants its wielder advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track creatures in wilderness environments. In addition, thrice per day, when you use this slingshot to make an attack, you can reroll the attack roll. If you do so and the attack hits, the creature is knocked prone.

Lore: A favored tool among Noxian assassins and spies, the Serrated Dirk ensures treachery finds its mark. Its jagged edge whispers promises of swift, silent ends, often linked to the shadows of the Black Rose.
DescriptionLore: This wicked-looking dagger is a +1 dagger that deals an additional 1d4 poison damage on a hit. Once per day, when you hit a creature with this dagger, you can choose to inflict a wound that bleeds for 1d4 slashing damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can use an action to staunch the bleeding.

Lore: Forged within Demacia, Sheen resonates with latent magic, briefly amplifying the wielder's power after spellcasting. Some believe it's imbued with petricite, a stone known to negate magic.
DescriptionLore: This powerful artifact, when held, allows you to channel residual spell energy into your next strike. Immediately after you cast a spell, the next weapon attack you make within 10 seconds deals an extra 2d8 force damage. This effect can only occur once per round.

Lore: A Demacian sigil of unyielding resolve, forged to ward against magic. Its steel and craftsmanship offer protection, a testament to Demacia's defenses against arcane threats. The symbol represents unwavering defense.
DescriptionLore: While holding this sigil, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that are not made of adamantine.

Lore: Tiamat, a weapon of brutal power, amplifies the wielder's bloodlust. Originating from Noxus, it whispers promises of destruction, pushing its user towards overwhelming and merciless force, often at the cost of their sanity.
DescriptionLore: This fearsome weapon amplifies the wielder's destructive potential. On a hit, you can choose to deal an extra 3d6 necrotic damage. If you do so, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be afflicted with short-term madness, as detailed in the Dungeon Master's Guide.

Lore: Favored by Noxian arena champions, the Vampiric Scepter feeds on the life essence of struck foes. Embodying the empire's brutal nature, it grants vitality to its wielder with each successful strike, a symbol of dominance in the arena.
DescriptionLore: This scepter, when wielded, grants you a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. Once per turn when you hit a creature with this magic scepter, you regain a number of hit points equal to the damage dealt. Additionally, for 1 minute after reducing a creature to 0 hit points with this scepter, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level.

Lore: Worn by Demacian sentinels, this mail is said to be imbued with the resilience of the mountains, offering unwavering protection to those who stand against the tide.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC. In addition, as a reaction when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you is forced to move, you can choose to anchor them in place. The creature must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the end of its turn. You can use this ability three times, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Forged under the watchful eyes of the Lunari, this moonplate grants swiftness and the fleeting grace of flight, empowering its wearer with the moon's elusive power.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this armor, your walking speed increases by 15 feet. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can activate the armor's wings, granting you a flying speed of 30 feet for 1 minute. Once you use this bonus action, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest. Finally, while wearing this armor you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

Lore: Wrought in the frozen heart of the Freljord, this mask resonates with ancient ice magic. It whispers promises of forgotten power, chilling the very air around its wearer.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this mask, you have resistance to cold damage. Additionally, enemies within 30 feet of you have disadvantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects that deal cold damage. Once per day, as an action, you can unleash a wave of bitter cold. Each creature within 30 feet of you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 8d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures made of water have disadvantage on this saving throw.

Lore: An instrument of celestial blessing, this censer is favored by those who channel the stars' protective light, empowering allies with radiant fire and unwavering focus.
DescriptionLore: While holding this censer, whenever you cast a spell that heals or grants temporary hit points to an ally, that ally's weapons become wreathed in celestial fire for 1 minute. For the duration, the ally deals an extra 1d4 radiant damage with weapon attacks and gains advantage on concentration saving throws. This effect can only be active on a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus at a time.

Lore: A shroud woven with protective enchantments, the Banshee's Veil offers sanctuary against the Black Mist, a fragile barrier against the terrors that haunt the Shadow Isles.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this veil, you are immune to the frightened condition. Additionally, the veil begins each day with 3 charges. Whenever you are targeted by a spell or other magical effect, the veil expends one charge and the effect is nullified. If the effect requires a saving throw, you automatically succeed instead. Once all charges are expended, the veil becomes non-magical until the next dawn, at which point it regains 3 charges.

Lore: Forged in the spectral flames of the Shadow Isles, this torch amplifies fire magic, but demands a life force tithe. Whispers claim Mordekaiser sought its power, indifferent to the cost. Wield with caution, mortal.
DescriptionLore: While holding this torch, you can cast spells that deal fire damage as if you were 2 levels higher, to a maximum of 20th level. However, each time you cast a spell that deals fire damage while holding the torch, you take necrotic damage equal to the spell's level. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, potentially by a Hemomancer. This blade hungers for blood, granting temporary strength to its wielder while stealing life from its victims.
DescriptionLore: This weapon deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage to any creature it hits. Whenever you hit a creature with this weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt (rounded down). These temporary hit points last for 1 minute.

Lore: A brutal weapon favored in the Noxian arenas. Legends say the Bloodthirster is quenched with the essence of fallen foes, granting the wielder a surge of vitality after each kill and heightening their bloodlust.
DescriptionLore: When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your level. Additionally, for the next minute, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

Lore: Aegis blessed by the celestial peaks of Targon. It offers unparalleled protection and the power to safeguard allies from impending harm. Shimmers with celestial light near Aspects and those touched by the Void.
DescriptionLore: While holding this divine shield, you gain a +3 bonus to AC. In addition, as a reaction when you or an ally within 30 feet of you is targeted by an attack, you can grant them advantage on the saving throw against that attack. Once you use this reaction, you cannot do so again until the start of your next turn. This shield glows with a soft, ethereal light in the presence of celestials or aberrations.

Lore: A belt pulsating with the raw power of Mount Targon. Empowers movement and grants the ability to channel cosmic energy, enhancing the strength of spells. A gift from the stars, bestowed upon those who seek cosmic harmony.
DescriptionLore: This belt pulses with cosmic energy. Your walking speed increases by 15 feet. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can channel cosmic energy to empower your spells. For the next minute, whenever you cast a spell that deals damage, you can add your Wisdom modifier to one damage roll of that spell. You can use this bonus action three times, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, the Dawncore pulses with celestial energy. Channeling the potent magic of twilight, it's said to amplify the power of those connected to the Aspects, particularly those who seek balance and understanding between realms.
DescriptionLore: This crystalline orb resonates with twilight magic. You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. As an action, you can unleash a wave of twilight energy, forcing each creature within 30 feet of you to make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d8 psychic damage and is stunned until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: A brutal testament to Noxian might, Death's Dance is favored by arena champions and battlemages alike. It rewards aggressive strikes and a refusal to yield, allowing the wearer to cheat death and retaliate with renewed ferocity, embodying the 'strength above all' creed.
DescriptionLore: While wearing Death's Dance, you gain a +3 bonus to AC and saving throws. Additionally, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do so, you gain temporary hit points equal to half your maximum hit points, and your speed is doubled until the end of your next turn. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: An amulet resonating with celestial healing energies, the Echoes of Helia are whispered to be a remnant of a forgotten Aspect of Targon, one dedicated to mending and preserving life. Its echoes restore allies while punishing those who would disrupt the natural order.
DescriptionLore: This sacred amulet holds 5 charges and regains 1d4+1 expended charges daily at dawn. As a bonus action, you can expend 1 charge to unleash a wave of celestial energy. Choose a creature within 30 feet; that creature regains 3d6 hit points and each enemy within 15 feet of that creature takes 1d6 radiant damage. The healing increases to 5d6 and the damage increases to 3d6 radiant damage when you reach 11th level, and to 7d6 healing and 5d6 radiant damage when you reach 17th level.

Lore: Woven from shadows and whispers, the Edge of Night is a cloak sought by spies and assassins across Runeterra. It grants its wearer the ability to fade into the darkness and deflect the first blow, buying them the precious seconds needed to strike from the void.
DescriptionLore: This cloak grants advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in dim light or darkness. As an action, you can pull the hood of the cloak over your head, creating a magical barrier that lasts until the start of your next turn. The barrier blocks the first instance of damage from a single attack or harmful spell that targets you. If the barrier absorbs any damage, the cloak's magic is expended, and it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: A crude yet powerful prototype of the Glorious Evolution, the Experimental Hexplate amplifies the wearer's strength to monstrous levels. However, its unstable hextech core can be volatile, a testament to Zaun's unrestrained pursuit of progress at any cost. Handle with extreme caution.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this armor, your Strength score becomes 20 unless it is already higher. The armor has 6 charges. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra 2d6 force damage to the target. The armor regains 1d6 expended charges daily at dawn. If the armor is reduced to 0 charges, roll a d20. On a 1, the hexplate malfunctions and becomes nonmagical.

Lore: Said to be blessed by ancient spirits of the Freljord, the Force of Nature resonates with the land's raw, untamed power. When wielded, one can briefly tap into the unbridled speed and resilience of a blizzard, moving with the howling wind itself.
DescriptionLore: You gain resistance to cold, lightning, and thunder damage. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can activate the Force of Nature, gaining a +30 feet bonus to your speed and the ability to move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your turn inside an object, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you moved through the object. This effect lasts for 1 minute. Once used, this bonus action cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Forged with petricite and imbued with a powerful warding spell, this armor is a symbol of Demacian resilience. It is whispered that a fragment of an ancient protector resides within, offering a second chance to those who champion the light.
DescriptionLore: When you drop to 0 hit points, you regain hit points equal to half your hit point maximum and are cured of any exhaustion. In addition, hostile creatures within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once used, this property of the armor cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Forged in the caldera of a dormant volcano and quenched in true ice, Heartsteel is said to contain the echoes of ancient Frostguard rituals and the strength of slumbering ice giants. Those who wear it find their vitality amplified, their very essence infused with the endurance of the Freljord itself.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this amulet, your Constitution score increases by 4, to a maximum of 24. Additionally, you gain resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can tap into the amulet's power, granting yourself temporary hit points equal to your level + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point). You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: Wrought from shipwrecked souls and ethereal mist, this lantern offers a deceptive warmth, a twisted beacon amidst the Shadow Isles' gloom. It weakens the undead, but its light also threatens to extinguish the wielder's own spirit, drawing them closer to oblivion with each use.
DescriptionLore: This lantern sheds dim light in a 15-foot radius. Undead creatures within the light have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws against your spells and abilities. As an action, you can intensify the light, increasing the radius to 30 feet and causing all undead creatures within to take 2d6 radiant damage. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. However, each time you intensify the light, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion.

Lore: A crown forged in the Immortal Bastion, it amplifies the wearer's presence. Champions who achieve power through conquest find their reputation magnified, bolstering their resolve and intimidating their foes. Beware, for the crown feeds on vanity, and its whispers can corrupt even the most stalwart soul.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this ornate crown, you gain advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks. Whenever you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). These temporary hit points stack, but the total number of temporary hit points you can have from this crown can't exceed your level. In addition, you can cast the spell 'Command' once per long rest, requiring no components.

Lore: Woven with true ice, the Iceborn Gauntlet grants its wearer the chilling power of the Freljord. Legends speak of frost mages who wielded similar artifacts to command blizzards and protect their frozen lands. The Gauntlet's touch slows foes and offers resilience against the bitter cold.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this gauntlet, you gain resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can slam the gauntlet into the ground, creating a burst of magical ice. Each creature within 15 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced by half until the end of your next turn. Additionally, on a hit with a melee weapon attack, you can choose to deal an extra 2d6 cold damage and reduce the target's speed by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

Lore: A symbol of Noxian dominance, the Imperial Mandate amplifies the force of coordinated strikes. It empowers those who seize control and rewards ruthless efficiency, turning weakness into an advantage for the empire's war machine.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this item, once per turn when you inflict the restrained, stunned, or incapacitated condition on a creature, the next ally to hit that creature with an attack deals an extra 4d6 damage of the same type as the original attack. Additionally, you and allies within 30 feet of you gain advantage on intimidation checks.

Lore: Forged in the heart of ancient Shurima, Jak'Sho adapts to withstand any threat. Whispers claim it was crafted to resist the Void's corruption, resonating with the resilience of those who ascended, and offering a shield against the inevitable.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this item, at the end of each long rest, choose one damage type. You gain resistance to that damage type until your next long rest. As a reaction when you take damage, you can expend a hit die to gain temporary hit points equal to twice the result of the die roll. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute.

Lore: An emblem of Demacian valor, the Knight's Vow binds the wearer to protect their allies. It echoes the unwavering oaths sworn by Demacia's warriors, embodying sacrifice and absolute loyalty in the face of danger, a testament to their unbreakable spirit.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this armor, when a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to interpose yourself, taking the damage instead. This damage cannot be reduced in any way. You must be able to see the creature taking damage. Additionally, while wearing this armor, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

Lore: A relic of the Ruination, Liandry's Torment radiates with the agony of souls trapped within the Black Mist. It amplifies suffering and ensures that no enemy escapes the lingering touch of torment, a fragment of the Shadow Isles' eternal curse.
DescriptionLore: This dark amulet pulses with malevolent energy. Once per day, as an action, you can curse a creature within 60 feet that you can see. For the next minute, any fire damage or necrotic damage dealt by you to the cursed creature ignores resistance to that damage type, and treats immunity as resistance. Additionally, at the start of each of its turns, the cursed creature takes 2d6 necrotic damage. A creature can only be affected by one instance of this curse at a time.

Lore: Forged on Mount Targon, the Locket of the Iron Solari embodies the sun's unwavering strength. It is a beacon of protection against the encroaching Void and other threats, radiating hope and resilience to those who stand beneath its light.
DescriptionLore: This radiant locket, blessed by the sun, radiates an aura of protection. As an action, you can expend 3 of its charges to grant yourself and all allies within 30 feet temporary hit points equal to your level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). Additionally, while wearing the locket, you and allies within 10 feet have advantage on saving throws against being frightened. The locket has 7 charges, and regains 1d6+1 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Inspired by the renowned Rune Mage, Luden, this device amplifies arcane energies. A favorite among Piltover's researchers, it channels residual magic, creating echoing bursts of power with each spell cast.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this mystical Ionian artifact, your spellcasting resonates with arcane energy. When you cast a spell that deals damage, choose one creature damaged by the spell. That creature takes an extra 1d6 force damage. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Wrought in Ionia, the Manamune resonates with the wielder's spirit, transforming inner focus into formidable force. Channeling the flow of vital energy, it empowers attacks with raw, untamed power.
DescriptionLore: This Ionian blade hums with spiritual energy. While attuned, you can use a bonus action to expend one of your unspent Hit Dice and infuse the blade with that energy. For the next minute, any attack you make with this weapon deals an extra amount of force damage equal to the number rolled on the Hit Die. This property can only be used once per long rest. Additionally, whenever you take damage while holding this weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

Lore: A relic of dark Noxian practices, the Soulstealer feeds upon the essence of the fallen. Each demise fuels its power, granting the wielder terrifying magical potential, though at a great risk; its hunger is never truly sated.
DescriptionLore: This Noxian artifact hungers for souls. When a creature dies within 30 feet of you, you gain 1 Soul Charge. You can have a maximum number of Soul Charges equal to your level. As a bonus action, you can expend any number of Soul Charges to gain a bonus to your spell attack rolls and saving throw DCs until the end of your turn. The bonus equals +1 for every 5 Soul Charges expended (minimum +1). If you are reduced to 0 hit points, you lose all Soul Charges.

Lore: A gift from the celestial realms of Targon, Mikael's Blessing wards against manipulation and despair. It embodies resilience, offering solace and freedom from the insidious grasp of malevolent influences.
DescriptionLore: While holding this amulet, you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As an action, you can touch one creature within 30 feet of you and end one condition afflicting it. The condition can be blinded, deafened, paralyzed, poisoned, or stunned. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

Lore: A forbidden tome resonating with necrotic energy. Its origins are shrouded in mystery, whispered to be a collection of spells harvested from the Shadow Isles and bound by a forgotten spirit in Valoran. It leeches vitality, preventing wounds from healing.
DescriptionLore: This heavy tome pulses with necrotic energy. While holding it, your spell attacks deal an extra 1d6 necrotic damage. Whenever you deal necrotic damage to a creature with a spell, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the end of your next turn. While poisoned in this way, the creature cannot regain hit points.

Lore: A weapon humming with dormant power, waiting for a worthy wielder. Said to be crafted from a World Rune fragment, it amplifies magical energy into devastating force. Its activation unlocks devastating arcane potential, but only for a fleeting moment.
DescriptionLore: This weapon crackles with potent, latent energy. While attuned to this weapon, you can use a bonus action to activate its Muramana ability. While active, your weapon attacks deal an extra 1d8 force damage. If you expend a spell slot while Muramana is active, the extra damage increases to 2d8 force damage until the end of your turn. This ability lasts for 1 minute, or until you choose to deactivate it as a bonus action. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

Lore: Forged in the ancient style of Ionian spirit blades. It allows for swift strikes and tactical repositioning, a dance of death mastered by few. Each critical strike leaves foes vulnerable, a momentary lapse that can shatter their resolve.
DescriptionLore: This +2 shortsword hums with barely contained energy. Once per short rest, when you take the Attack action on your turn, you can choose to teleport to an unoccupied space within 30 feet after each attack made as part of that action, before making the next attack. If you do so, your movement does not provoke opportunity attacks until the end of the turn. Additionally, when you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

Lore: A suit of blackened plate armor forged in the heart of Noxus. Quenched in blood and imbued with dark magic, it bolsters the wearer's strength and instills fear in their enemies. Those who dare strike the wearer risk having their life force violently drained.
DescriptionLore: This suit of +2 plate armor is forged of blackened steel and emanates an aura of menace. While wearing this armor, you gain the following benefits: You have advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength (Intimidation) checks. When a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to force the creature to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes necrotic damage equal to your level. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: A greataxe pulsating with profane energy, whispered to be empowered by the Crimson Circle. It rewards aggression with unparalleled lethality, but at a terrible cost. Those slain by the axe find their souls ripped away, preventing any return.
DescriptionLore: This +3 greataxe pulses with dark energy. While wielding this weapon, you gain a +10 bonus to damage rolls against creatures that are not constructs or undead. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can expend one hit die and cause the axe to deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage on a hit until the end of your turn. Any creature reduced to 0 hit points by this axe has its life essence violently ripped away, preventing resurrection unless the body receives a *Wish* spell or similar magic. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Forged in the biting winds of the Freljord, this armor is imbued with the resilience of the Iceborn. It is said to weather the most savage storms and blunt the force of even the mightiest blows, offering protection against all that seek to break the wearer.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this armor, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, as a reaction when you are hit by an attack, you can force the attacker to make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker's speed is halved until the end of their next turn.

Lore: A monstrous greatsword, pulsating with dark energy. Bound to a parasitic spirit, it hungers for the life force of its victims, granting strength and vitality to its wielder with each strike. Legends whisper of warlords rising to power, fueled by the Hydra's insatiable thirst.
DescriptionLore: This magical greatsword grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 3d6 necrotic damage to the target. If you do, you gain temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Crafted in the hidden monasteries of Ionia, this bow channels the fury of the storm. Each arrow splits into a tempest of projectiles, embodying the harmony between chaos and control, punishing multiple enemies simultaneously.
DescriptionLore: This elegant bow, crafted in Ionia, hums with latent energy. When you make a ranged attack with this weapon, you can target up to three creatures within 30 feet of each other. Make a separate attack roll against each target. On a hit, the attack deals normal damage. This property can be used a number of times equal to your Dexterity modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: A celestial amulet resonating with the power of Targon's Aspects. It grants the wearer a reservoir of pure magic, a font of mystical energy that can be unleashed to amplify spells and shield against harm, a true testament to the celestial power.
DescriptionLore: Wondrous item, requires attunement by a spellcaster. This shimmering amulet grants you a reservoir of magical energy. You gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier x your level in a spellcasting class. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. Once per long rest, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose to expend any number of these temporary hit points to cast the spell as if using a spell slot one level higher for every 10 temporary hit points spent (maximum of 5th level). For example, you could spend 20 temporary hit points to cast a 3rd level spell using a 5th level spell slot.

Lore: This rod vibrates with celestial energy. It amplifies the courage of allies, inspiring them with the echoes of Targonian Aspects, creating a harmonious battle cry that empowers and quickens the steps of those who heed its call.
DescriptionLore: While holding this rod, you can use a bonus action to unleash a celestial battle cry. For the next minute, you and all allies within 30 feet gain the following benefits: Your movement speed increases by 10 feet, and once on each of your turns, you can deal an extra 1d6 radiant damage when you hit a target with an attack.

Lore: Forged in the First Lands, this spear channels the wielder's ki, bridging the physical and spiritual realms. It is said that a true master can mend grievous wounds or unleash devastating power through it.
DescriptionLore: This spear grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend a Ki point (if you have any) to regain hit points equal to the damage dealt. Alternatively, you can use a bonus action to focus your inner strength; for the next minute, your weapon attacks deal an additional 1d8 force damage.

Lore: Crafted from riverwood and imbued with the calming essence of Ionian streams, this staff empowers its wielder to share life-giving energy with their allies, like a gentle current nurturing all it touches.
DescriptionLore: This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls. As an action, you can touch a willing creature and grant them 'flowing water'. For the next minute, whenever the target casts a spell that restores hit points to another creature, that creature also gains temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1).

Lore: A gauntlet forged for the Dauntless Vanguard, Sterak's Gage is a symbol of Demacian resilience. It allows the wearer to endure even the most grievous wounds, embodying the unwavering spirit of Demacia.
DescriptionLore: This imposing gauntlet grants +2 to Strength and Constitution. As a reaction when you are reduced to 0 hit points, but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do so, you gain temporary hit points equal to half your hit point maximum. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. Once used, this property of the gauntlet cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: A brutal weapon favored by Noxian legionnaires, the Stridebreaker allows its wielder to crush their foes' will with a wave of concussive force, scattering enemy lines and paving the way for conquest.
DescriptionLore: This weapon grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. As an action, you can unleash a wave of force in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and their speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of your next turn. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: Whispers abound of a bargain struck in the depths, imbuing this pistol with a dark hunger. It claims the last breath of the dying, delivering a final toll of ill-gotten gains to its wielder, ensuring that all debts are ultimately paid.
DescriptionLore: This pistol requires ammunition and can be loaded as a bonus action. When you hit a creature with this pistol, if that creature's hit points are at or below 5% of its maximum hit points, that creature dies. Additionally, killing a creature with this pistol grants you an additional 25 gold.

Lore: Forged in the depths of Bilgewater's shipwrecks, the Titanic Hydra pulses with the rage of a colossal sea monster. Legends say it was crafted from the heart of a Kraken, forever hungry and seeking to crush all in its path.
DescriptionLore: This massive, grotesque weapon is crafted from the solidified heart of a monstrous sea creature. While attuned to this weapon, your Strength score increases by 4, to a maximum of 24. You can use a bonus action to activate the Hydra's Might. For 1 minute, your melee weapon attacks deal an extra 1d8 bludgeoning damage, and you can use your reaction when a creature within 15 feet of you hits you with an attack to force the attacker to make a DC 18 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus. You can use Hydra's Might three times, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: A legendary weapon, its origins lost to time, the Trinity Force embodies the essence of adaptability. Said to have been wielded by heroes across Runeterra, it grants its wielder a fraction of their combined power.
DescriptionLore: This gleaming weapon pulses with arcane energy. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Whenever you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, roll a d6. On a 1-2, your speed increases by 15 feet until the end of your turn. On a 3-4, you regain 1d6 hit points. On a 5-6, the target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn. Once you use this property, you can’t use it again until the start of your next turn.

Lore: A relic of the Ruination, Unending Despair is a conduit for the Black Mist, amplifying the suffering of those nearby. It whispers promises of solace, only to drown its victims in an eternity of sorrow.
DescriptionLore: This artifact pulses with necrotic energy. When a creature within 30 feet of the artifact fails a saving throw, you can use your reaction to inflict one level of exhaustion on that creature. Additionally, undead creatures within 60 feet of the artifact have advantage on saving throws against being turned or frightened.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Icathia, before its fall to the Void, the Void Staff channels the raw, corrupting energy of the abyss. Those who wield it risk being consumed by the nothingness it commands.
DescriptionLore: Staff, Very Rare (Requires Attunement by a Spellcaster). This staff crackles with eldritch power drawn from the void. While holding this staff, your spell attack rolls ignore resistance to necrotic damage. Additionally, once per day, you can cast the spell 'Blight' without expending a spell slot. When you cast 'Blight' in this way, its damage type becomes force.

Lore: Forged in the ancient hearths of the Freljord, Warmog's Armor is imbued with the resilience of the mountains. It grants its wearer unmatched endurance, a bulwark against the harshest winters and deadliest foes.
DescriptionLore: Armor (Plate), Legendary (Requires Attunement). While wearing this armor, your hit point maximum increases by 40. Additionally, at the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier if you have at least 1 hit point. This regeneration does not function if you have taken fire or radiant damage since the end of your last turn.

Lore: Forged in Ionia, this blade whispers insidious doubts, eroding the resolve of its victims with subtle suggestions. Its edge seems to hum with a discordant melody, unsettling the mind.
DescriptionLore: This Ionian blade whispers insidious suggestions. Any creature you hit with this weapon must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw it makes before the end of its next turn.

Lore: Crafted by the Yun Tal, these arrows are fletched with wood said to resonate with the spirit realm, imbuing them with elemental power. Each flight connects the archer to the land, a whisper of Ionia's ancient magic.
DescriptionLore: These arrows are crafted from wood rumored to be from the spirit realm. When you fire one of these arrows, you can speak a command word to imbue it with elemental energy (acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder). The arrow deals an extra 2d6 damage of the chosen type, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

Lore: Forged in the Freljord's icy grip, this armor binds two warriors in a bond of shared strength. Legends speak of bloodsworn siblings facing down blizzards and betrayals, their fates intertwined by its chilling embrace.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this Freljordian armor, you can use a bonus action to forge a bond with one willing creature you can see within 30 feet. The bond lasts for 1 minute or until you are more than 30 feet apart. While bonded, whenever you hit a creature with an attack, the bonded creature gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt. Additionally, the bonded creature's attacks deal an extra 1d6 cold damage.

Lore: Bound with dark magic from the Shadow Isles, this spear offers a pact: mutual strength for a shared fate. An unbreakable bond, yet severing it invites unforeseen consequences from the mists of undeath.
DescriptionLore: This spear magically binds to one willing creature, forming a symbiotic link. While bound, you and the chosen ally gain a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws as long as you are within 30 feet of each other. If either of you drops to 0 hit points, the other can choose to take the damage instead. However, severing the bond requires a Wish spell or similar magic, and the ally may suffer unforeseen consequences tied to the Shadow Isles, determined by the DM.

Lore: Favored among the Buhru, this firearm is a conduit to Nagakabouros. Prayers whispered through its barrel are said to reach the Bearded Lady with greater speed, carrying the fervor of Bilgewater's faithful.
DescriptionLore: This ornate firearm grants advantage on Wisdom (Religion) checks made to beseech or understand Nagakabouros. Once per long rest, you can expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher while firing this weapon to send a prayer to the Bearded Lady. The prayer's effect is determined by the DM, but it might grant a blessing, advantage on a future roll, or a subtle nudge of fate.

Lore: A crude effigy resembling a scarecrow. It whispers of forgotten fears and the approach of something ancient and hungry from the Shadow Isles, a primal demon known as Fiddlesticks.
DescriptionLore: As an action, you can place this Small object on the ground. For the next hour, creatures within 30 feet have disadvantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to detect your lies or deceptions. Additionally, if Fiddlesticks is within 1 mile of the effigy, the effigy causes creatures within 30ft to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Lore: Forged in a time of war, likely during the Rune Wars, this armor was designed to protect defensive fortifications. Faint enchantments linger, a testament to the mages who bolstered its defenses against relentless sieges.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this armor, you gain a +2 bonus to AC against ranged attacks. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against being knocked prone by a ranged attack or effect. Finally, any critical hit against you from a ranged attack becomes a normal hit.

Lore: Favored by hunters who stalk the frozen wastes of the Freljord. It whispers of ancient pacts with the land and the spirits of the hunt, some say even a forgotten Ice Witch imbued it with her power.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this item, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track creatures in snowy or icy terrain. Additionally, as an action, you can cast the Hunter's Mark spell without expending a spell slot. Once you use this ability, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest. Finally, you gain resistance to cold damage.

Lore: Pulsing with wild, untamed magic, this item resonates with the spirit of Ionia. It feels as if the land itself has imbued it with power, echoing the potent ley lines of the First Lands.
DescriptionLore: While holding this item, you can use a bonus action to imbue your next attack or spell with volatile energy. If the attack hits or the spell affects a creature, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take an additional 2d6 lightning damage and become stunned until the end of your next turn. Once you use this ability, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: Masterfully crafted by Demacian armorers, this armor was specifically designed to fortify defenses. Subtle enchantments, possibly woven by mageseekers, reinforce its ability to withstand ranged assaults.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this armor, you gain a +2 bonus to AC against ranged attacks. Additionally, any critical hit you suffer while wearing this armor becomes a normal hit.

Lore: A marvel of Piltovan engineering, the Power Field projects a localized shield, deflecting blows and anchoring allies. Initially designed for construction, its defensive capabilities were quickly recognized for security applications, then adapted for tactical squads.
DescriptionLore: You can use an action to activate this device, creating a 30-foot radius sphere of shimmering energy centered on you. For 1 minute, or until you use an action to end it, you and any allies within the sphere gain a +4 bonus to AC and saving throws against effects that would move or knock them prone. Once used, this device cannot be activated again until the next dawn.

Lore: Woven by Lunari mystics on the slopes of Mount Targon, this cloak whispers of the celestial dance. It offers solace from the sun's harsh gaze, granting its wearer the protection of the night and the ability to summon its concealing veil.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this cloak, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that deal radiant damage. Additionally, once per long rest, you can cast the Darkness spell (requiring no components) centered on yourself; while this darkness persists, you can see through it as if it were dim light.

Lore: A brutal weapon favored in the Noxian arenas. "Cruelty" grants its wielder an advantage against those who cower in fear, ensuring that weakness is swiftly punished. Its edge thirsts for blood, leaving its victims vulnerable and broken.
DescriptionLore: This weapon grants advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are frightened. In addition, whenever you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

Lore: A legendary greatsword forged in the fires of Noxus and steeped in the blood of champions. "Decapitator" is more than just a weapon; it is a symbol of ruthless strength, capable of crippling even the mightiest warriors, leaving them diminished in both body and spirit.
DescriptionLore: This magical greatsword scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. When you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or have their maximum hit points reduced by an amount equal to the damage dealt. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The greatsword deals an additional 2d6 slashing damage to any target that has less than half of its maximum hit points.

Lore: A relic pulsing with the chilling energy of the Shadow Isles. The Embrace grants resistance against death's touch while offering the power to unleash spectral tendrils, ensnaring foes and poisoning them with the essence of forgotten spirits.
DescriptionLore: While holding this item, you gain resistance to necrotic damage and your Constitution score increases by 2, to a maximum of 22. As a bonus action, you can unleash a shadowy tendril to strike a creature within 30 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 3d6 necrotic damage and become poisoned until the end of your next turn. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Forged by the hardy Iceborn, this spear is tipped with a diamond formed under the immense pressure of the Howling Abyss. It is said to have pierced the hides of the largest mammoths and even wounded ancient creatures of the Freljord's past.
DescriptionLore: This spear is a magic weapon that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When you hit a creature with this spear, the diamond tip deals an extra 2d6 piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Lore: A shard of a celestial dragon's essence, Dragonheart resonates with the cosmic fire of Targon. Wielders claim it whispers secrets of constellations and echoes with the roars of long-vanished dragons. The Solari seek to harness its power, while others fear its untamed celestial wrath.
DescriptionLore: This amulet is a holy (or unholy, depending on the celestial dragon) symbol and requires attunement. While attuned, you have resistance to fire damage and your spells that deal fire damage deal an additional 1d8 fire damage. As an action, you can expend 3 charges to unleash a wave of celestial fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 6d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This item has 7 charges and regains 1d6+1 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Named for a compassionate healer of old Demacia, Eleisa's Miracle embodies the kingdom's unwavering spirit of hope and healing. It radiates a comforting aura, mending wounds and offering solace to those who defend the weak.
DescriptionLore: This amulet is a holy symbol and requires attunement. While attuned, as a bonus action you may touch a creature and expend a hit die plus your Wisdom modifier to heal them, and they are cured of one disease or condition from the following list: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned. The number of hit points restored is equal to the number rolled plus your Wisdom modifier (minimum of one hit point). Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the start of your next turn. This amulet has 3 charges, and it regains all expended charges daily at dawn. Additionally, once per long rest, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can expend a charge to instead drop to 1 hit point.

Lore: Woven from the purest ice by a forgotten Ice Witch, Everfrost radiates an unnatural chill. It whispers promises of control and dominion over the frozen wastes, a tempting power for those who seek to bind the Freljord to their will.
DescriptionLore: This staff, potentially crafted by a Freljordian Ice Witch, allows you to cast the spell *Hold Person* once per day. Additionally, as an action, you can cause a 20-foot cone of freezing air to emanate from the staff. Creatures in the cone must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced by half until the end of their next turn. On a failed save, creatures also take 2d6 cold damage.

Lore: Forged in the heart of the Immortal Bastion, the Force of Entropy embodies Noxus's ruthless ambition. It corrupts magic, twisting it into a weapon of overwhelming power, leaving only ruin and despair in its wake. Those who wield it risk being consumed by its insatiable hunger.
DescriptionLore: This weapon, forged in the heart of Noxus, pulses with dark energy. Once per day, when you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can choose to inflict an additional 4d6 necrotic damage. If you do so, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity ability checks and saving throws until the end of their next turn.

Lore: A marvel of Piltover engineering, the Galeforce crossbow uses compressed air to deliver bursts of speed. Favored by couriers and daredevils alike.
DescriptionLore: This light crossbow, rumored to be crafted by ancient Ionian windspeakers, allows you to cast the spell *Gust of Wind* as a bonus action. The spell save DC for this effect is 15. Once per day, as an action, you can also unleash a powerful gust of wind that allows you to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

Lore: Forged in Demacia from petricite, the Gargoyle Stoneplate bolsters defenses. It’s rumored ancient techniques allow temporary invulnerability, resembling stone.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this armor, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. As an action, you can fortify the Stoneplate, granting you temporary hit points equal to your level. While fortified, your speed is halved, and you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you are reduced to 0 hit points. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: Wrought in Noxus during the height of blood magic, this helm empowers hemomancers, turning wounds into strength. Whispers claim it thirsts for more...
DescriptionLore: While wearing this helm, whenever you cast a spell that deals necrotic damage, you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. In addition, as a bonus action, you can expend one Hit Die to regain hit points equal to the number rolled + your Constitution modifier. You can't use this bonus action if you have 0 hit points. Once you use this bonus action, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: A relic blessed by Targon, the Innervating Locket radiates celestial power. It strengthens body and spirit, offering a bastion against the encroaching void.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this locket, you gain a +2 bonus to Strength and Constitution saving throws. Additionally, as a reaction when you or an ally within 30 feet is reduced to 0 hit points, you can expend a Hit Die. Roll the die and add your Wisdom modifier to the result. The target regains hit points equal to the total. You can't use this reaction if you have 0 hit points. Once you use this reaction, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: Crafted by the Ursine of the Freljord, these rods draw lightning, imbuing the wielder with the storm's fury. Some bear the mark of Volibear himself.
DescriptionLore: While holding this rod, you have advantage on saving throws against lightning damage. Once per day, when you are hit by a lightning attack, you can use your reaction to absorb the lightning. For the next minute, your melee weapon attacks deal an extra 1d6 lightning damage. Some rods bear faint claw marks, indicating a possible connection to Volibear.

Lore: Forged under the glow of a full celestial alignment, the Moonflair Spellblade channels the raw power of the moon. It is said to resonate with those touched by the Lunari, especially those who walk a path of both magic and martial prowess. Its light is a beacon against the shadows.
DescriptionLore: This blade hums with lunar energy. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While attuned to this weapon, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Once per long rest, as a bonus action, you can invoke the lunar power, causing the blade to shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. While lit this way, the next attack you make before the end of your turn deals an extra 3d6 radiant damage. This weapon is strongly associated with the Lunari of Targon.

Lore: A favored weapon amongst the elite assassins of the Noxian warbands, the Prowler's Claw embodies the principle of swift and decisive action. It allows the wielder to strike from the shadows with deadly precision, leaving no trace but a fallen foe and a whisper of dread.
