Lore: Forged with celestial silver, this amulet embodies the purest light of Targon. It is said to be blessed by the Aspects themselves, offering solace and protection against the insidious influence of corruption and despair, safeguarding the wearer's mind and body.
DescriptionLore: This intricately carved amulet is crafted from pure silver and blessed by celestial beings. As an action, you can touch one willing creature and end one of the following conditions affecting it: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, poisoned, or stunned. Once used, this property of the amulet cannot be used again until the next dawn. Additionally, the wearer has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

Lore: A shard of solidified arcane energy, remnants of the Ascended Host's dominion over Shurima. It was used to dissolve those deemed unworthy. Now it crackles with residual power, threatening to unmake all that stands in its path. Imbues the wielder's attacks with lethal force.
DescriptionLore: This small, crystalline shard hums with latent energy. As an action, you can target a creature within 60 feet of you that has Challenge Rating 1 or lower. That creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is disintegrated, turning to fine dust. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points by this effect, only dust remains. Once you use this shard, it cannot be used again until the next dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack or spell and the attack roll or spell DC includes your proficiency bonus, you can add an additional 1d6 force damage.

Lore: Crafted by nomadic tribes of Shurima, these enchanted boots grant incredible speed and agility to those who traverse the shifting sands. Messengers, scouts, and relic hunters alike rely on their magic to outpace sandstorms and evade ancient guardians, allowing safe passage through the desert.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, your base walking speed increases by 15 feet. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can activate the boots' enhanced mobility. For the next 10 minutes, your walking speed is doubled, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks and saving throws. Once this bonus action is used, the boots cannot be activated again until the next dawn.

Lore: Forged under the watchful eye of the moon on Mount Targon, this blade hums with Lunari magic. It empowers its wielder with the moon's ethereal light, offering protection from mind-altering magic and the ability to channel its radiant energy.
DescriptionLore: This elegant longsword is perpetually bathed in soft moonlight. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. While attuned to this weapon, you can cast the Moonbeam spell (3rd level version) once per long rest without expending a spell slot. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened while holding the blade.

Lore: A forbidden tome rumored to contain necromantic secrets gleaned from the Immortal Bastion's darkest corners. Whispers link it to the Black Rose, suggesting its power allows manipulation of life and death, albeit at a terrible cost.
DescriptionLore: This weighty tome radiates an aura of dark magic. While holding the Morellonomicon, you can cast the Life Transference spell once per day. Additionally, any creature you hit with a spell attack suffers one level of exhaustion after the spell resolves. Once used, the Life Transference property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Forged in a forgotten age of Shurima, this blade hums with arcane energy. Legend claims it was commissioned by an Ascended being, granting the wielder enhanced power and a swift, magically empowered strike.
DescriptionLore: Weapon (any sword or dagger), very rare (requires attunement). You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you deal an extra 1d6 force damage. Once per turn, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can make a melee attack with this weapon as a bonus action.

Lore: Crafted from rare crystals found across Valoran, this rod focuses and amplifies arcane energies. Spellcasters find it an invaluable tool for channeling and unleashing potent magic.
DescriptionLore: Rod, rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster). While holding this rod, your spell attack bonus increases by +2 and your spell save DC increases by 2. Additionally, you can use a bonus action to reroll one damage die of a spell you just cast. You must use the new roll.

Lore: A cursed grimoire emanating from the Shadow Isles, steeped in necrotic magic. Those who dare to wield it find themselves drawing power from the realm of the dead, at risk of becoming consumed by its darkness.
DescriptionLore: Wondrous item, very rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster). This grimoire pulses with necrotic energy. While holding it, you gain advantage on death saving throws. When you cast a spell that deals necrotic damage, you can maximize one of the damage dice instead of rolling it. This property can't be used again until the next dawn. Additionally, undead creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

Lore: Woven by Ionian shadow masters, these tabi grant unparalleled stealth and speed. Legends say they allow the wearer to move unseen, blending with the spirit of the land itself.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, your Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to move silently are made with advantage. Additionally, when you take the Dash action on your turn, your movement speed increases by 20 feet until the end of the turn.

Lore: Worn by the hardy folk who traverse the slopes of Mount Targon. It offers protection and bolsters allies, a testament to the mountain's enduring spirit.
DescriptionLore: While you wear this medallion, you gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws. In addition, as an action, you can expend 1 charge to grant yourself and each creature within 30 feet of you that you can see temporary hit points equal to 1d6 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). This medallion has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Woven with anti-magic threads by Demacian mages, this mantle shields against arcane assaults. A common sight among frontline soldiers and the vigilant mageseekers, it embodies Demacia's unwavering resolve against magic.
DescriptionLore: You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. While wearing this mantle, you can use your reaction when you are hit by a spell to attempt to nullify the spell's effect. Make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect on you and is instead reflected back to the caster, targeting them as if they had cast it. If the caster is immune to the spell or effect it is simply negated.

Lore: A brutal weapon favored by Noxian commanders. The Obsidian Cleaver weakens armor, leaving foes vulnerable to the empire's relentless onslaught. Each swing embodies Noxian dominance.
DescriptionLore: This massive obsidian greataxe deals an extra 2d6 slashing damage to any creature wearing armor. Additionally, once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to reduce the AC of the target by 1, to a minimum of 10, until the end of your next turn. This effect stacks.

Lore: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, this helm wards against magic and bitter cold. Some say it was crafted by the Iceborn, blessed by ancient spirits to endure the harshest winters and magical blizzards.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this helm, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, you have resistance to cold damage and can withstand extreme cold environments without penalty. The helm also grants you the ability to cast the *Absorb Elements* spell once per long rest.

Lore: A Piltovan invention, this specialized hammer is designed for breaching defenses and disabling constructs. Commonly used by demolition teams in the Undercity, or sometimes against rogue automatons.
DescriptionLore: This adamantine warhammer grants you advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to climb. Additionally, as an action, you can strike a Large or smaller construct or object. That construct or object must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn. You can use this ability three times, regaining all expended uses at dawn.

Lore: Forged in the mountains of Ionia by a master bladesmith. It is said that this blade contains a whisper of Oponn, a trickster spirit of swiftness, granting the wielder bursts of incredible speed.
DescriptionLore: This +2 Shortsword hums with a subtle energy. Once per day, as a bonus action, you can speak the sword's command word to imbue it with the Swiftness of Oponn. For the next minute, your movement speed doubles, and you gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

Lore: Brewed by the Mageseekers, this elixir grants clarity of sight, piercing through illusions and revealing hidden magic. A crucial tool in the pursuit of those who defy Demacia's laws.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this shimmering, silver liquid, you gain the benefits of the See Invisibility spell for 1 hour. Additionally, for the same duration, you have advantage on saving throws against illusions and on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to detect deception. As a bonus action, you can end the effect early to cast Detect Magic, requiring no components.

Lore: Woven with threads spun from starlight on Mount Targon, this hood protects against celestial influence. It is favored by those who seek to understand, or perhaps defy, the will of the Aspects.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this hood, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened by celestial beings or effects originating from the Astral Plane. Additionally, you gain a +3 bonus to Wisdom (Insight) checks made to discern the true nature of celestials and aberrations. Once per day, when you fail a saving throw against a celestial effect, you can choose to succeed instead.

Lore: An ancient artifact from the Freljord, radiating intense cold. Legend claims it holds a fragment of a frozen storm, allowing its wielder to summon blizzards and weather the harshest winters.
DescriptionLore: While holding this orb, you are immune to the effects of extreme cold. Additionally, you can cast the 'ice storm' spell once per day, using your Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17). The orb regains its ability to cast 'ice storm' at dawn.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, this armor is a symbol of dominance. Each strike empowers the wearer, drawing strength from their foe's pain and turning it into brutal advantage. Only the strongest survive wearing it.
DescriptionLore: This suit of plate armor is forged from blackened steel and etched with stylized depictions of brutal combat. While wearing this armor, you gain the following benefits: You have advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength checks. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage to the target and gain temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Forged in the glacial heart of the Freljord, these pauldrons whisper tales of a forgotten Iceborn warrior who commanded blizzards with a mere gesture. The ice from which they are wrought never melts, holding the chill of the tundra within.
DescriptionLore: These pauldrons are crafted from shimmering ice that never melts. While wearing these pauldrons, you gain resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can summon a blizzard in a 20-foot radius centered on you. The blizzard lasts for 1 minute, and the area within it is heavily obscured. Any creature that starts its turn in the blizzard or enters it for the first time on a turn must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 4d6 cold damage. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

Lore: Whispers claim this pendant is blessed by the Zephyrs of Ionia, spirits of the wind who guide lost travelers and quicken the steps of the worthy. Its touch grants a fleeting grace, allowing the wearer to dance with the wind itself.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this pendant, your base walking speed increases by 10 feet, and you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that you can see. In addition, you can cast the Feather Fall spell once per long rest without using a spell slot.

Lore: A marvel, and menace, from Piltover's early Hextech age. This device allows a moment of perfect invulnerability, but at the cost of unstable energy release. Repeated use led to its ban, deemed too volatile even for Piltover's risk-tolerant inventors.
DescriptionLore: This stopwatch has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to become invulnerable to all damage for 1 round. At the end of your next turn, you become stunned until the end of your next turn. The stopwatch regains its charges when an hextech crystal is fed to it.

Lore: A crude weapon, commonly seen in the fighting pits of Noxus. Each strike weakens the foe, leaving them vulnerable to a follow-up attack. A symbol of brutality and dominance, favored by those who claw their way to the top.
DescriptionLore: This brutal weapon grants +1 to attack and damage rolls. On a hit, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on the next attack roll they make before the end of their next turn.

Lore: Worn by those who seek enlightenment on the slopes of Mount Targon. This medallion aids in resisting distractions and provides clarity in moments of doubt, a beacon for those striving for inner peace amidst the mountain's trials.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this medallion, you gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws. Additionally, once per long rest, when you fail a Wisdom saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead. The medallion then loses this property until the next dawn.

Lore: Crafted by Ionian artisans attuned to the wind spirits, this item grants swiftness and agility to those who resonate with its energy. Some believe it enhances one's connection to the natural world, allowing for effortless movement and balance.
DescriptionLore: This item grants the wearer a +1 bonus to their initiative rolls and increases their movement speed by 10 feet. As a bonus action, the wearer can also grant themselves advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks until the end of their turn. Once used, this bonus action can't be used again until the start of the wearer's next turn.

Lore: A murky concoction likely stolen from some unfortunate soul on the Serpent Isles. It carries the faint scent of brine and the bitter tang of regret, offering fleeting respite to those who dare imbibe.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this potion, you regain 2d4 + 2 hit points. This potion's color swirls with shades of murky green and smells faintly of brine and regret.

Lore: Seized from a rival ship's stores or scavenged from a forgotten cove, this ward is vital for any Bilgewater captain looking to gain an advantage. Planted in secret, it reveals approaching threats, allowing for cunning ambushes or timely escapes.
DescriptionLore: This small, magically imbued totem can be planted as an action. For the next 8 hours, the ward is invisible and emits a pulse out to a 60-foot radius. Any creature entering this radius is clearly visible, and you are alerted to their presence (but not their location) if you are within 1 mile of the ward. A ward has an AC of 10, 1 hit point, and is immune to poison and psychic damage. It can be destroyed.

Lore: Forged for those who hunt in the shadows of Noxus, this dirk is favored by assassins and bounty hunters alike. Some whisper it's imbued with the essence of a fallen darkin, granting its wielder a chilling edge in their grim work.
DescriptionLore: This dagger is a magic weapon. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. Additionally, once per long rest, when you hit a creature with this dagger that is below half of its maximum hit points, you can choose to deal an additional 3d6 necrotic damage. If you do so, you gain advantage on all Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track that creature for the next 24 hours.

Lore: A beloved treat throughout the Freljord. These snacks are irresistible to poros, the region's most adorable inhabitants. Feeding a Poro-Snax creates an unbreakable bond, leading to unwavering loyalty and assistance in the frozen wastes.
DescriptionLore: A delicious treat adored by poros. As an action, you can feed a Poro-Snax to a friendly Poro. The poro becomes especially loyal and helpful, granting you advantage on one Wisdom (Animal Handling) check you make to interact with it within the next hour. Alternatively, if no poros are present, consuming a Poro-Snax yourself grants you advantage on the next Wisdom (Survival) check you make to navigate through snowy or icy terrain within the next hour.

Lore: A forbidden tome penned by a hemomancer obsessed with weaponizing disease for Noxus. Its pages detail vile rituals capable of spreading plagues, granting its wielder resilience against illness and amplifying the potency of poisons.
DescriptionLore: This ancient tome is rumored to contain vile hemomantic rituals capable of weaponizing disease. While holding the Pox Arcana, you can cast the Contagion spell once per long rest without expending a spell slot. Additionally, you gain advantage on saving throws against contracting diseases, and whenever you successfully inflict a creature with the poisoned condition, the duration of the condition is doubled.

Lore: Forged on Mount Targon, it pulses with the celestial energies of the Solari. It burns brightest against creatures of shadow, a beacon of hope against the encroaching darkness.
DescriptionLore: Forged on the summit of Mount Targon, this weapon pulses with celestial energy. While attuned to Primordial Dawn, you can use a bonus action to cause it to emit bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. As an action, you can call upon the weapon's power to cast the Sunbeam spell (save DC 17) once per day. The weapon deals an extra 1d8 radiant damage to any creature that is vulnerable to sunlight.

Lore: An amulet once believed to be a blessing from a forgotten Noxian noble, Priscilla's Blessing now embodies cruel ambition. It whispers promises of power, rewarding those who spill blood in the name of Noxus with strength and insight into their victims' deepest desires.
DescriptionLore: This dark amulet is said to have been blessed by a forgotten Noxian noble. While wearing Priscilla's Blessing, you gain advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks. Additionally, once per day, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points, you can gain temporary hit points equal to the creature's challenge rating. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. If the creature was a humanoid, you also learn one piece of information about its deepest desires or fears.

Lore: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, this blade hums with elemental energy. Legend says it guides its wielder to hidden veins of ore and precious gems, revealing secrets buried beneath the frozen earth.
DescriptionLore: This finely crafted blade hums with a faint, icy energy. Once per day, when you hit a creature with this sword, you can choose to have the attack deal an extra 2d6 cold damage and reduce the creature's speed by 10 feet until the end of its next turn. The blade is rumored to lead the wielder to caches of valuable ore and precious gems, revealing hidden veins and deposits within a 1-mile radius while attuned.

Lore: A marvel of early hextech experimentation, this unstable prototype holds immense potential. Infusing it with one's life force unlocks temporary enhancements, hinting at the boundless possibilities of melding flesh and machine. Viktor would be very proud.
DescriptionLore: This intricate device pulses with arcane energy and strange potential. As an action, you can expend a hit die to infuse the Hex Core with your life force, granting you one of the following benefits for 1 minute: Advantage on Intelligence checks and saving throws; Resistance to lightning damage; or the ability to cast the *shocking grasp* cantrip, even if you don't know it. You can only have one benefit active at a time. Further experimentation may unlock additional enhancements.

Lore: Fashioned from the essence of wraiths, these threads bind the will of the living. Those who wield them dance with the dead, controlling mortal puppets for fleeting moments before their souls are utterly consumed.
DescriptionLore: This tangled skein of ghostly threads grants the user control over the bodies of others. As an action, you can target one humanoid within 30 feet that you can see. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to mentally command the target to move up to its speed and perform one simple action that it would normally be capable of. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to the effects of the Puppeteer for 24 hours.

Lore: Woven with threads of pure spirit energy, this sash shields the wearer from mental intrusions. Often carried by those venturing into lands touched by the spirit realm, seeking respite from ethereal influence, though whispers link some to ventures in Bilgewater.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this sash, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, or possessed. Additionally, as a reaction when you fail a saving throw against an effect that would charm, frighten, or possess you, you can choose to succeed instead. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Crafted by the legendary mage Rabadon, this crown amplifies arcane power, channeling raw magic through the wearer. Its use is whispered to be dangerous, potent enough to rend the veil between realms, and bestow upon the user untold power at a terrible price.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this crown, your spell attack bonus and spell save DC each increase by 2. In addition, the damage dice of your spells are maximized (e.g., a d6 becomes a 6). Once per long rest, when you cast a spell of 5th level or lower, you can cast it as if using a spell slot one level higher.

Lore: Forged by Ionian spirit walkers, these boots allow effortless passage through untamed lands. Each step resonates with the land, ensuring the wearer treads in harmony with nature's path, leaving no trace behind.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, you ignore difficult terrain. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can expend 1 charge to cast the *pass without trace* spell. The boots have 3 charges and regain 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing these boots and attuned to nature, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to navigate or track.

Lore: Worn by Demacian scouts patrolling the kingdom's vast borders. This cloak allows for swift movement and silent passage, vital for protecting Demacia's frontiers from encroaching threats, human or beast.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this cloak, your speed increases by 10 feet. Additionally, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to move silently through natural environments.

Lore: A feather shed by a celestial being near the peak of Mount Targon. Inscribed with faint constellations, it whispers truths to those who listen closely, aiding them in discerning honesty from deceit.
DescriptionLore: This quill, plucked from a celestial being, radiates a faint aura of justice. While holding the Rectrix, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks. Additionally, once per long rest, you can use the quill to cast the Zone of Truth spell (DC 15).

Lore: Forged in the celestial forge, Redemption embodies selfless sacrifice. It whispers of ancient pacts made atop Mount Targon, where mortals and celestials intertwined fates for the greater good, a beacon of hope amidst despair.
DescriptionLore: This sacred amulet embodies sacrifice and healing. As an action, you can touch a creature and expend a charge to heal it for 4d6 hit points. Additionally, if a creature within 30 feet of you drops to 0 hit points, you can expend a charge as a reaction to cause it to instead drop to 1 hit point. The amulet has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Brewed by Ionian herbalists from rare plants found only in hidden groves, this potion mends wounds and revitalizes the spirit, drawing upon the land's inherent life force to accelerate healing.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this potion, you regain 4d4 hit points. In addition, for the next minute, you regain 1 hit point at the start of each of your turns (10 hit points total). This potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

Lore: Frozen tears of an ancient Iceborn, this bead holds the resilience of the Freljord itself. It thaws briefly when crushed, releasing a surge of restorative power, capable of purging sickness and mending grievous wounds, a testament to survival against the harshest elements.
DescriptionLore: This bead is frigid to the touch, and faintly glows with frost. As an action, you can crush the bead, releasing its energy. You regain 2d8 hit points, and are cured of one disease or poison affecting you.

Lore: A shield bearing the winged emblem of Demacia, forged for those who stand as bulwarks against injustice. It represents unwavering loyalty and the willingness to sacrifice for the safety of others, a symbol of Demacian virtue.
DescriptionLore: While holding this shield, when a creature within 5 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to transfer half of the damage (rounded up) to yourself. You must be able to see the creature. Additionally, while wielding this shield, you have advantage on saving throws against effects that would knock you prone.

Lore: A shard of power left behind by an Ascended being of Targon. It hums with celestial energy, amplifying the wielder's innate magical abilities and offering resilience in the face of arcane exhaustion.
DescriptionLore: While holding this remnant, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases by 2. Additionally, you regain 1 sorcery point or 1 expended spell slot of 3rd level or lower upon finishing a short or long rest. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

Lore: A fragment of the Watchers' chilling essence, recovered from the deepest glacial rifts of the Freljord. It whispers promises of frozen dominion, shielding its bearer while granting the power to bind foes in unrelenting ice.
DescriptionLore: While holding this remnant, you have resistance to cold damage and advantage on saving throws against being frightened. As an action, you can attempt to freeze a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or become restrained for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the restrained creature can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: Forged in the heart of the Void, this dark artifact hungers for life force. It empowers spells with devastating force, leeching vitality from enemies to sustain its wielder, but at a terrible price, slowly succumbing to the corruption of the Void itself.
DescriptionLore: This dark artifact grants you a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls with spells. Whenever you deal damage with a spell, you regain hit points equal to 1d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. Additionally, you ignore resistance to necrotic damage. This item is cursed. Becoming attuned to this item extends the attunement duration indefinitely. While attuned, at the end of each long rest, you must succeed on a DC 10 Charisma saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion. If you die from exhaustion, your body is overtaken by the Void.

Lore: Wrought in the ancient forges of the Frostguard, this gauntlet channels the frigid power of the Freljord. It allows the wearer to command the very cold, encasing the battlefield in ice and slowing the advance of any who dare tread upon it.
DescriptionLore: This gauntlet, perpetually cold to the touch, is forged from ice that never melts. While wearing the gauntlet, you can use an action to freeze a 15-foot cone of ground in front of you. This area becomes difficult terrain. Additionally, any creature that starts its turn or enters the area for the first time on a turn must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its movement speed reduced by half until the end of its next turn. The ice melts after 1 minute. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

Lore: A relic resonating with echoes of bygone eras, originating from the slopes of Targon. It imparts ancient wisdom and bolsters the user's defenses against the ravages of time and magic, whispering forgotten truths to those who listen closely.
DescriptionLore: This rod, pulsing with a faint celestial light, whispers secrets of ages past to its wielder. The rod has 10 charges and regains 1d6+4 expended charges daily at dawn. While holding the rod, you can expend charges to gain the following benefits: (1 charge) You gain advantage on one Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw. (3 charges) You regain 2d8 hit points. (5 charges) You cast the 'Greater Restoration' spell. If you listen to the whispers of the rod for at least 1 hour each day, you gain one level of exhaustion at the end of the hour, but also gain resistance to psychic damage until the next dawn.

Lore: Forged with celestial energies on Mount Targon, the Ruby Sightstone pulses with a warm light. Legends claim it's a fragment of a fallen Aspect's gaze, granting unparalleled awareness to those who wield it, piercing even the deepest shadows. It whispers secrets of approaching dangers, allowing its bearer to anticipate threats before they materialize.
DescriptionLore: This crimson stone, warm to the touch, grants unparalleled awareness of your surroundings. As an action, you can touch a point within 60 feet of you. For the next hour, you know the location of all creatures within a 30-foot radius of that point. This ability pierces magical darkness and nonmagical barriers, but is blocked by one foot of stone, one inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn. While attuned to the Ruby Sightstone, you are immune to the blinded condition.

Lore: Etched with the chilling runes of the ancient Iceborn, the Runecarver hums with glacial magic. Each strike evokes the power of the frozen wastes, binding enemies in icy shackles and unleashing the unforgiving cold of the Freljord. It echoes with forgotten oaths and the wrath of a land locked in perpetual winter.
DescriptionLore: This weapon pulses with ancient glacial magic. Once per long rest, when you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 6d6 cold damage to the target and force it to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is also restrained for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Lore: A relic from the age of the Iceborn, the Runegorger was used to consume and redirect raw magical power. It radiates the absorbed energies of ancient runes, granting the wielder a temporary surge of vitality and empowering their attacks with raw force. Its use is whispered to be a dangerous path, teetering on the edge of primal chaos.
DescriptionLore: This relic radiates a faint aura of consumed power. When you use this item to absorb a magic rune or magical effect (DM's discretion), you gain temporary hit points equal to five times the level of the spell or effect consumed. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. Additionally, for the next minute, your weapon attacks deal an extra 1d6 force damage.

Lore: A shield favored by Demacian sentinels, the Runic Bulwark deflects magic with ancient runes. It stands as a symbol against unchecked magic, protecting its wielder from spells and magical effects. Some believe it was forged using forbidden magic, a secret the Demacian military refuses to acknowledge.
DescriptionLore: While holding this shield, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, once per day, when you are targeted by a spell, you can use your reaction to attempt to absorb the spell's energy. Make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect on you, and you regain a number of hit points equal to the spell's level x 5.

Lore: This arcane focus pulses with the vibrant spirit magic of Ionia. Channeling the energies of the spirit realm, it amplifies the wielder's spells and creates echoes of pure force. It resonates with ancient monasteries and the whispering winds of the First Lands, empowering those who seek harmony with the spiritual world.
DescriptionLore: This arcane focus pulses with Ionian spirit magic. While holding this focus, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. Additionally, once per long rest, when you cast a spell that deals damage, you can choose to deal an additional 2d6 force damage to one target within 30 feet of the original target. This additional damage is considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity.

Lore: Worn by Ionian monks seeking harmony, this ring amplifies inner peace. It whispers guidance, allowing the wearer to mend wounds and find clarity in moments of doubt.
DescriptionLore: This ring hums with tranquil energy. While wearing this ring, you have advantage on Wisdom saving throws. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can expend a hit die to regain a number of hit points equal to the die roll + your Wisdom modifier. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) per long rest.

Lore: A relic from the fall of the Ascended, this claw echoes with the might of Shurima's god-warriors. Each strike drains the vitality of those who dare oppose its wielder, leaving them weakened and vulnerable.
DescriptionLore: This ancient claw, imbued with the power of fallen Ascended, grants potent abilities. The claw is a +2 magical melee weapon. When you hit a creature with it, you can force the target to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains one level of exhaustion. On a successful save, the target takes 2d6 necrotic damage. This effect can only be used once per turn.

Lore: A crimson mark bestowed by Noxian hemomancers. It grants the power to mend wounds with stolen life, a dangerous exchange that demands a heavy toll. The price of survival is the creeping embrace of exhaustion.
DescriptionLore: This dark gift, pulsing with crimson energy, is bestowed upon those who enter into a pact with entities of pure hemomancy. While attuned to this gift, whenever you deal damage with a spell or weapon attack, you can choose to regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage dealt (rounded up). This effect can only be used once per turn. However, at the end of each long rest, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion as the gift demands its due.

Lore: An amulet pulsing with Void energy. It promises immense strength to those who embrace its hunger, but demands a constant stream of life force, lest its wearer be consumed by ravenous exhaustion.
DescriptionLore: This grotesque amulet, reeking of voidal energies, grants the wearer an insatiable hunger for power. While attuned to the Sated Devourer, you gain the following benefits: Your Strength score increases by 4, to a maximum of 24. Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. After a long rest you must consume the life force of a beast or humanoid by succeeding on a DC 16 grapple check, or suffer two levels of exhaustion.

Lore: Forged with pure crystal, this orb allows Demacian sentinels to pierce the veil of the unseen. It reveals hidden threats and whispers secrets, ensuring the safety and vigilance of Demacia's borders.
DescriptionLore: This Demacian-made crystal orb allows the user to cast the Scrying spell without expending a spell slot. Once attuned, you may cast the Scrying spell once per day. Additionally, while holding the orb, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to detect hidden creatures or objects within 30 feet.

Lore: Crafted in Noxus, the armguard whispers of secrets known to the Black Rose. It's said to amplify a mage's resilience against arcane backlash, a necessary safeguard for those who dabble in forbidden arts.
DescriptionLore: This dark iron armguard, etched with arcane symbols, grants its wearer a +2 bonus to AC. While wearing the armguard, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects. Additionally, as a reaction when you are hit by a spell attack, you can absorb some of the spell's energy, gaining temporary hit points equal to the spell's level.

Lore: A fragment of pure, concentrated despair ripped from the heart of the Shadow Isles. It pulses with the agony of countless trapped souls, promising power at the cost of sanity. Those who hold it too long risk becoming another echo in the Mist.
DescriptionLore: This shard of pure darkness radiates a chilling aura. While holding it, you are resistant to necrotic damage and your hit point maximum cannot be reduced. Once per day, as an action, you can unleash the shard's power, forcing each creature within 30 feet to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 3d6 necrotic damage and become frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The shard whispers to you in your dreams, urging you to embrace despair.

Lore: Forged in the biting winds of the Freljord, this weapon carries the chill of a thousand winters. Each strike weakens the foe, slowing their advance and leaving them vulnerable to the harsh elements... or a killing blow.
DescriptionLore: This Freljordian weapon grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When you hit a creature with this weapon, the attack deals an extra 2d6 cold damage and the target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn. In addition, when you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

Lore: A fragment of True Ice, holding a sliver of the ancient power wielded by the Iceborn. Though diminished, it still grants glimpses through the frozen veil, chilling the hearts of those who dare to oppose its wielder. Whispers say it remembers Lissandra's touch.
DescriptionLore: This shard pulses with ancient ice magic. As an action, you can touch the shard to a point within 60 feet. A spectral eye appears there, granting you and your allies vision of that area for 1 minute. Additionally, once per day, you can cast the Slow spell (save DC 15) from the shard. While holding the shard, you have resistance to cold damage.

Lore: Honed in Demacia, the Sheen amplifies the inherent magic of the wielder, channeling righteous energy into devastating blows. It resonates with justice, empowering those who fight for the ideals of Demacia with each strike.
DescriptionLore: This polished stone hums with righteous energy. Once per short rest, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a spell slot as a bonus action. The attack deals an extra 2d8 radiant damage per level of the spell slot expended. If you have no spell slots, you can use this effect once per long rest to deal 2d8 radiant damage.

Lore: A bulwark against the unseen, crafted by Demacian artisans for the Dauntless Vanguard. Its protective aura reinforces allies against encroaching shadows, embodying Demacia's unwavering resolve.
DescriptionLore: While holding this shield, you can use a bonus action to activate it, granting yourself and each ally within 30 feet of you temporary hit points equal to your level + your proficiency bonus. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. Once used, the shield can't be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: A celestial relic resonating with the grace of the Aspects. It whispers of protection, granting swiftness and resilience to those bathed in its ethereal light. A beacon against the void.
DescriptionLore: This holy symbol allows you to cast the Shield spell at will, without expending a spell slot. Additionally, as an action, you can invoke the Reverie, granting all allies within 30 feet of you advantage on Dexterity saving throws and increasing their movement speed by 15 feet for 1 minute. Once you use this action, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

Lore: Forged in the glacial heart of the Freljord, this weapon offers respite from even the most insidious control. It is a symbol of unyielding will, defying the icy grip of despair and domination.
DescriptionLore: While holding this weapon, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As an action, you can unleash the Silvermere Dawn, ending one condition (blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, or poisoned) affecting you. Additionally, for the next minute, you have advantage on saving throws against effects that would impose any of those conditions on you. Once used, this ability can't be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: A blade favored by Ionian duelists, humming with latent energy. It grants its wielder enhanced reflexes and nimble footwork, turning every skirmish into a dance of precision and cunning.
DescriptionLore: This elegant sabre hums with latent energy. While wielding this weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to initiative rolls. Additionally, once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack using this sabre, you can choose to move up to half your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Lore: A Bilgewater trick, promising riches with a hidden cost. This charmed sack tempts the greedy with fool's gold, often delivering more than just coin to those who reach too deep. Beware the serpent's kiss.
DescriptionLore: This seemingly ordinary sack is charmed to produce more gold. Once per day, when you reach into the sack, it contains 1d20 + 50 gold pieces. However, there is a 10% chance that instead of gold, the sack contains a non-magical poisonous snake (use the stats for a Poisonous Snake from the Monster Manual) that immediately attacks.

Lore: Whispers of the Black Rose cling to the Soul Sickle, a tool of dark ambition. Its edge promises power, but demands a terrible price in hunger and control. Those who wield it find their desires twisting, their will fading, consumed by the Rose's insidious influence.
DescriptionLore: This magical sickle, rumored to be forged in the soulfires of the Black Rose, whispers dark promises to its wielder. While holding the Soul Sickle, you have disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per day, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this sickle, you gain temporary hit points equal to the creature's maximum hit points. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour.

Lore: Forged in the Shadow Isles, the Spectral Cutlass whispers with the agony of trapped souls. Its touch steals life, binding the fallen to its ethereal blade. Only the strong-willed can resist its chilling call, lest they too become another echo within its haunted steel.
DescriptionLore: A chilling blade from the Shadow Isles. This magic cutlass deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage on a hit. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you can choose to trap its soul. The soul remains trapped within the cutlass until you use an action to release it, or until the cutlass is destroyed. While a soul is trapped, you gain advantage on saving throws against being frightened. You can only have one soul trapped at a time.

Lore: Woven from the mists of the Shadow Isles, the Spectre's Cowl offers a fragile shield against the specters that roam its blighted shores. It is a ward against possession, a beacon of resilience in a land consumed by undeath.
DescriptionLore: This ethereal cowl offers protection against the supernatural. While wearing the cowl, you have resistance to necrotic damage and advantage on saving throws against being possessed. Additionally, as an action, you can invoke the cowl to cast the Sanctuary spell (save DC 15) on yourself. Once used, this property cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Forged from petricite mined from the forests surrounding Demacia, the Spellbreaker is a symbol of unwavering resolve against magic. Mageseekers rely on it, its mere presence disrupting arcane energies and shielding them from harm.
DescriptionLore: This rare shield is crafted from petricite, a stone that disrupts magic. While wielding this shield, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, as a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you casts a spell, you can attempt to disrupt the spell. Make a DC 15 ability check using your choice of Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma. On a success, the spell fails and has no effect.

Lore: An amulet imbued with the strength of the first golems of the Freljord. It hums with ancient power, offering resilience against the biting cold and the crushing force of the land itself, a connection to the enduring spirits of the north.
DescriptionLore: This very rare amulet pulses with the ancient magic of the Freljord. While wearing this amulet, your hit point maximum increases by 20. Additionally, you gain resistance to cold damage and have advantage on saving throws against being petrified. As an action, you can tap into the spirit of the golem, granting yourself temporary hit points equal to your level. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: Whispers of the Shadow Isles cling to this spectral orb. It pulses with the chilling essence of forgotten wraiths, offering a semblance of life to those who dare wield its power, though at a steep cost. Some say it contains the essence of a powerful wraith, forever bound to the material realm.
DescriptionLore: This legendary artifact whispers with the chilling energy of the Shadow Isles. While holding this spectral orb, you gain the following benefits: Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to your level. You have resistance to necrotic damage. As a bonus action, you can become ethereal until the end of your next turn. While ethereal, you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. You take 5 (1d10) force damage if you end your turn inside an object. Once you use this bonus action, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: Forged in the heart of a dying star by celestial artisans, the Starcaster resonates with the song of creation. It amplifies the power of those touched by the Aspects, weaving starlight into potent magic. It is rumored that only a true child of the cosmos can unlock its full potential, drawing power directly from the celestial realm.
DescriptionLore: This instrument, imbued with the raw power of the cosmos, resonates with those touched by celestial forces. If you are a Celestial Warlock, Sorcerer with the Aberrant Mind or Divine Soul origin, or a Cleric of the Knowledge or Twilight Domain, you can use the Starcaster as a spellcasting focus. While wielding it, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases by 3. Additionally, when you cast a spell that deals radiant damage, you can reroll any 1s on the damage dice, and must use the new result.

Lore: A potent enchantment woven into the very fabric of being. It enhances one's innate abilities, unlocking hidden potential and granting a deeper understanding of oneself. The source of this magic remains a mystery, though some whisper of ancient runes and forgotten rituals.
DescriptionLore: This grants a permanent +2 to one ability score of your choice, up to a maximum of 20. In addition, you gain proficiency in one skill associated with that ability (if you are already proficient, you gain expertise instead).

Lore: Carved from the wood of a spirit tree and imbued with Ionian ki, this staff aids in the pursuit of inner peace. Favored by monks and meditators, it strengthens the mind against external forces, allowing one to find serenity amidst chaos. Legends tell of a grandmaster who used a similar staff to calm a raging storm, proving the power of a centered mind.
DescriptionLore: While holding this quarterstaff, you gain a +3 bonus to Wisdom saving throws. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can expend 1 ki point to gain advantage on the next saving throw you make before the end of your next turn. If you have no ki points, you can still gain advantage on the saving throw, but you suffer one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Forged in Demacia's hallowed forges, these shoulderguards bear the crest of the Dauntless Vanguard, a now-defunct order known for their unwavering courage. They instill resilience in the wearer, shielding them from fear and harm. A symbol of unbreakable will, they stand as a testament to Demacia's unwavering spirit.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these shoulderguards, you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened. In addition, when you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail. Once per long rest, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead.

Lore: Favored by Ionian duelists for its swiftness. The blade hums with a faint energy, said to quicken the spirit and reflexes of its wielder. Often used in ceremonial duels to test one's inner harmony.
DescriptionLore: This exquisitely balanced shortsword hums faintly when held. You gain a +1 bonus to initiative rolls. As a bonus action, you can speak the sword's command word to imbue it with spirit energy for 1 minute. While imbued, your movement speed increases by 10 feet, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks and saving throws.

Lore: Forged atop the First Lands by a reclusive smith, Stormrazor crackles with harnessed lightning. Legends say it channels the fury of the storm dragon, granting its wielder unmatched striking speed and shocking power.
DescriptionLore: This magical longsword crackles with electrical energy. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. Once per short rest, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 2d6 lightning damage and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

Lore: Forged from a fragment of the sun at the peak of Mount Targon, this aegis radiates celestial fire. A symbol of the Solari, it wards against the encroaching darkness, burning away shadows and bolstering the faithful.
DescriptionLore: This radiant shield is forged from celestial metal. While holding this shield, you have resistance to fire damage and gain a +2 bonus to your AC. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can activate the Aegis's aura. While the aura is active, any creature within 10 feet of you takes 1d6 radiant damage at the start of each of its turns. The aura lasts for 1 minute, and you can't use this ability again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: An amulet crafted by Ionian spirit walkers. It deepens the connection between individuals, allowing them to share burdens and perceive each other's emotions with clarity. A potent tool for meditation and strengthening spiritual bonds.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this amulet, once per long rest, when a creature within 30 feet that you can see takes damage, you can choose to take half of that damage instead, rounded down. Additionally, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to discern the emotional state of creatures you have a bond with.

Lore: A crude but effective Zaunite contraption, T.U.R.B.O. grants bursts of incredible speed and strength, pushing the user to their limits. Prone to malfunction and potentially lethal, it is favored by desperate mercenaries and reckless daredevils seeking a quick edge.
DescriptionLore: This crude but effective device functions as a wondrous item. As an action, you can activate T.U.R.B.O., granting you the following benefits for 1 minute: Your movement speed doubles. You gain advantage on Strength checks and saving throws. At the end of each of your turns while T.U.R.B.O. is active, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion. Once used, T.U.R.B.O. cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Forged on Targon's slopes, this brace hums with celestial energy. Rakkor warriors often carry these, empowering them to shield the weak and deflect harm with divine protection.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this brace, you can use a bonus action to grant one creature within 30 feet of you temporary hit points equal to your level. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. Additionally, as a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see is hit by an attack, you can impose disadvantage on the attack roll, potentially causing it to miss. You can use each of these features a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: A crystallized fragment of celestial magic, said to weep with starlight. Mages across Runeterra seek these to amplify their connection to the heavens, drawing upon its boundless arcane potential.
DescriptionLore: While holding this crystalline tear, you can use a bonus action to recover 1d4 expended spell slots. The combined level of spell slots recovered cannot exceed 2. Once used, this property cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Etched with ancient runes, this stone allows instantaneous travel. Used by wandering monks and merchants, it whispers of distant temples and bustling marketplaces across Ionia.
DescriptionLore: This small, intricately carved stone allows you to cast the Teleport spell once. When you cast the spell in this way, you ignore the 'familiarity' requirement; you can teleport to any location you have seen before, regardless of how well you know it. Once used, the stone turns to dust.

Lore: A pulsating shard resonating with alien power, rumored to be linked to Bel'Veth's ascendance. It whispers promises of resilience, but slowly drains vitality from those nearby.
DescriptionLore: This pulsating, obsidian shard grants the user resistance to necrotic damage. Additionally, as an action, you can touch a creature and force them to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's maximum hit points are reduced by 1d6 for 1 hour. You can't use this ability again until the next dawn.

Lore: A ring steeped in intrigue, favored by agents of the Black Rose. It sharpens the mind against manipulation and offers a glimpse into the art of subtle persuasion.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this ring, you have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against being charmed or frightened. In addition, once per day, you can cast the Suggestion spell (save DC 15). This ring is associated with the Black Rose and enhances the wearer's cunning and resilience.

Lore: Forged in the heart of the Bastion, this armor is a symbol of defiance and brutal resilience. Each spike whispers tales of battles endured, said to amplify the wearer's pain and reflect it back upon their enemies. A testament to Noxian resolve.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this armor, whenever a creature hits you with a melee attack, the attacker takes piercing damage equal to your proficiency bonus. In addition, you have resistance to piercing damage. This armor is favored by melee combatants and warriors of the Iron Legion, with each spike rumored to be quenched in the blood of the fallen.

Lore: A tarnished coin from the Sun Empire's zenith. It echoes with forgotten rituals and the whispers of ascended emperors, a stark reminder of Shurima's glorious past and devastating fall, hinting at secrets yet unearthed.
DescriptionLore: This timeworn coin, a relic from a fallen Shuriman dynasty, whispers of forgotten wealth. While holding the coin, you can cast the *Detect Magic* spell once per long rest. Additionally, once per week, you can meditate with the coin for 1 hour to gain advantage on a single History check related to Shurima.

Lore: An icy relic once wielded by a powerful Ice Witch. It chills the very air around it, offering glimpses into frozen memories and the power to bind foes in glacial stasis. A fragment of the ancient, untamed Freljord.
DescriptionLore: This icy artifact, once held by a powerful Ice Witch of the Freljord, allows you to glimpse echoes of the past and hinder your enemies. As an action, you can touch an object or creature to perceive a brief vision of its recent past. Additionally, once per day, you can cast *Ray of Frost* as a 3rd-level spell (spell save DC 15).

Lore: Blessed by the aspects of Targon, this medallion guides and protects those who traverse the mountain's treacherous paths. It resonates with celestial energy, offering solace and strength to weary travelers seeking enlightenment or refuge among the stars.
DescriptionLore: Favored by the nomadic ascetics of Mount Targon, this medallion grants resilience and guidance. You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to navigate mountainous terrain. As an action, you can touch a creature and grant it temporary hit points equal to your level. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. You cannot use this ability again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: A dagger humming with the dormant power of the Frostguard. Legends say it can siphon magical energy from its victims, leaving them vulnerable to the biting Freljord cold. A relic of forbidden ice magic.
DescriptionLore: While holding this dagger, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and the save DC of your spells. Once per day, when you hit a creature with a spell attack using this dagger, you can choose to steal a spell slot from the target. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or lose one random spell slot of the highest level they have available. You regain a spell slot of the same level. This dagger also grants resistance to cold damage.

Lore: Forged on the slopes of Mount Targon, this timeworn brace hums with celestial energy. Legends say it was once wielded by a Solari warrior, offering protection and bolstering their allies against the Void's encroaching darkness. Its power resonates with the echoes of ancient battles fought beneath the watchful eyes of the Aspects.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this brace, you gain a +2 bonus to AC. As an action, you can unleash a celestial wave. Each creature within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be knocked prone and take 3d8 radiant damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. Once used, this property cannot be used again until the next dawn. Additionally, allies within 10 feet of you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

Lore: A hearty biscuit crafted with pure glacial water and infused with ancient Iceborn magic. A single bite restores vitality and fortifies the spirit, granting resilience against the Freljord's unforgiving elements and bolstering the will against despair. It whispers of forgotten hearths and the enduring strength of the Iceborn.
DescriptionLore: When you consume this biscuit, you regain all hit points. For the next 24 hours, you have advantage on saving throws against exhaustion and you are immune to the effects of extreme cold. Additionally, you can breathe normally in any environment, and you gain resistance to cold damage for the duration.

Lore: A masterfully crafted knife favored by nomadic tribes and wandering Ascended. Etched with Shuriman glyphs, it allows the wielder to perceive the echoes of movement across vast distances, uncovering hidden paths and revealing the presence of creatures in the shifting sands. A tool of survival and a relic of a fallen empire.
DescriptionLore: This ornate knife grants advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track creatures. Additionally, as an action, you can plunge the knife into the ground and visualize the movements of creatures within 1 mile for the next minute. The DM determines what information is revealed, but it typically includes the number, type, and general direction of travel of creatures.

Lore: A compact vial containing a potent elixir favored by Noxian legionnaires on grueling campaigns. Though less potent than the elixirs consumed by the Trifarix, it provides remarkable resilience, allowing soldiers to endure the harshest conditions and carry burdens beyond their normal capacity. A symbol of Noxian fortitude and unwavering resolve.
DescriptionLore: For 1 hour after drinking this potion, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. Additionally, your carrying capacity is doubled for the duration.

Lore: A crimson elixir brewed in the heart of Noxus, rumored to contain ingredients that incite primal aggression. Consumed by warriors before battle, it sharpens the senses, bolsters strength, and grants unnatural vitality, turning soldiers into relentless engines of war. A testament to Noxian might and the unbridled fury of its legions.
DescriptionLore: For 1 minute after drinking this potion, you gain advantage on attack rolls and Strength checks and saving throws. In addition, at the start of each of your turns, you gain 5 temporary hit points.

Lore: A weapon coveted across Runeterra. Forged using techniques from multiple regions, the Trinity Force harmonizes diverse fighting styles. From Ionian dueling stances to Noxian pit fighting brutality, it amplifies the wielder's versatility, making them a master of all combat aspects.
DescriptionLore: This magical weapon grants +2 to attack and damage rolls. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, the next attack roll you make before the end of your next turn gains advantage. Additionally, once per turn, when you cast a spell, the next weapon attack you make before the end of your turn deals an extra 1d8 force damage.

Lore: A Zaunite invention, the Turbo Chemtank is a volatile piece of engineering. Primarily used in blitzkrieg assaults, it allows for devastating breaches of enemy lines, leaving behind a trail of noxious fumes and shattered defenses. Caution advised, uncontrolled use may lead to unpredictable side effects.
DescriptionLore: This wondrous item requires attunement. As an action, you can activate the Chemtank, gaining the following benefits for 1 minute: Your movement speed is doubled. You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks and Strength saving throws. At the end of each of your turns while the Chemtank is active, each creature within 5 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of your next turn. Once used, the Chemtank cannot be activated again until the next dawn.

Lore: Crafted within the spectral depths of the Shadow Isles, the Twin Mask is a conduit for restless spirits. It allows the wearer to tap into the thoughts of others and project their deepest fears, sowing panic and disarray. Whispers say it amplifies the user’s own buried anxieties as well.
DescriptionLore: This unsettling mask requires attunement. While wearing this mask, you can cast the 'detect thoughts' spell at will, without expending a spell slot. Additionally, as an action, you can target one creature you can see within 30 feet and force it to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened by you for 1 minute. The frightened creature must use its movement on each of its turns to move as far away from you as possible. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

Lore: Haunted pauldrons from the Shadow Isles, the Twin Shadows are imbued with lingering echoes of past tragedies. They conjure spectral duplicates to sow confusion and dread. The shadows whisper promises of power, but demand a heavy price: the wearer's sanity.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to these spectral pauldrons, you can cast the *invisibility* spell once per day. When you do, two translucent, ghostly duplicates of yourself appear alongside you for the duration of the spell. These duplicates mimic your movements but provide no tactical advantage beyond visual distraction.

Lore: Forged in the tempestuous monasteries of Ionia, Typhoon Claws embody the raw power of the ocean and sky. They grant unmatched skill in unarmed combat, channeling the force of raging storms to disrupt enemies and provide unwavering balance against nature's fury.
DescriptionLore: These handwraps grant a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with unarmed strikes. Additionally, once per short rest, when you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can attempt to push the target up to 15 feet away from you in a straight line. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pushed and knocked prone. Finally, you gain advantage on saving throws against being swept away or knocked prone by powerful gusts of wind or water.

Lore: Forged in the heart of the Shadow Isles, this amulet amplifies the despair that permeates the land. It whispers of power fueled by sorrow, a constant reminder of the Ruination's lasting torment. Those who wield it risk succumbing to the island's eternal anguish.
DescriptionLore: This dark amulet whispers promises of power fueled by sorrow. While wearing it, you gain resistance to necrotic damage and advantage on saving throws against being frightened. However, at the end of each long rest, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion. Furthermore, any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be overwhelmed with despair, suffering disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of its next turn.

Lore: A scepter imbued with hemomancy, likely crafted within the Noxian ranks. Perhaps a tool favored by a follower of Vladmir, used to siphon the life force of others to empower the wielder's dark arts and mend their own wounds.
DescriptionLore: This scepter pulses with dark energy. While holding it, you gain the following benefits: You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls. Whenever you cast a spell that deals damage, you regain hit points equal to 1d4 + the level of the spell. This healing cannot exceed the amount of damage dealt by the spell. In addition, once per long rest, as an action, you can expend a number of hit dice up to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take necrotic damage equal to the total rolled on the hit dice and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.

Lore: A rallying standard of the Dauntless Vanguard, inspiring courage and unwavering resolve. It bolsters Demacian forces, enabling them to stand firm against overwhelming odds and embodying the indomitable spirit of Demacia.
DescriptionLore: This banner radiates courage. While the banner is within 30 feet of you and unfurled, you and friendly creatures within 30 feet of you gain the following benefits: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened. You can reroll any attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, but you must use the new roll. Each friendly creature can only use this reroll once per long rest. As a bonus action, you can plant the banner into the ground. While planted, the banner emanates an aura that grants advantage on death saving throws to friendly creatures within 60 feet. The banner remains planted until you use a bonus action to uproot it. The banner can be destroyed (AC 10, 10 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage).

Lore: This dagger, imbued with dark magic, is rumored to have been forged by the Black Rose. It grants its wielder the ability to drain the essence of their enemies under the cover of darkness, a cruel tool that embodies the hidden power struggles within Noxus.
DescriptionLore: This dagger hums with shadowy power. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a creature with this dagger, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage to the target and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. The dagger has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dusk. Additionally, you can cast the *darkness* spell once per long rest without using a spell slot.

Lore: A simple ring often bestowed upon young mages in Ionia. It aids in their early arcane studies, granting a slight edge in manipulating magic, and serves as a reminder of the delicate balance between spirit and power within the First Lands.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this ring, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC. Additionally, you regain 1 hit point at the start of each of your turns if you have at least 1 hit point.

Lore: Forged from the horn of a long-dead ice drake, this horn echoes with the ancient power of the Freljord. When blown, it instills a primal fear in the hearts of your enemies, a chilling reminder of the land's unforgiving spirit.
DescriptionLore: As an action, you can blow this horn. Each creature within 30 feet of you that is hostile must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once used, the horn cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Born amidst the volcanic vents of the Frostguard Citadel's underbelly, Scorchclaw Pups are more than mere pets; they're living embers of the Freljord's fiery heart, offering warmth and a touch of chaotic flame to those who dare befriend them.
DescriptionLore: You can use an action to summon a Scorchclaw Pup familiar. It uses the statistics of a Weasel, but it also deals 1 fire damage with its bite attack. As a bonus action, you can command the pup to breathe a cone of fire that deals 1d4 fire damage in a 15-foot cone. Creatures in the area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or take the damage. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest. If the pup dies, it reappears after 1d4 days.

Lore: A sentinel of unwavering vigilance, Control Wards embody Demacia's commitment to light and order. They pierce through shadows and illusions, exposing hidden enemies and safeguarding the kingdom from unseen threats.
DescriptionLore: When you use an action to plant this magical ward, it becomes invisible. The ward has AC 10, 1 hit point, and is immune to poison and psychic damage. A creature can use an action to attempt a DC 12 Intelligence (Investigation) check to spot the ward. If the check succeeds, the ward becomes visible. While active, the ward emits a magical aura in a 60-foot radius. This aura reveals invisible creatures and objects, and it suppresses magical illusions, revealing their true form. The ward lasts for 8 hours or until destroyed.

Lore: Brewed by Ionian monks using ancient techniques and spirit blossoms, this potion mends wounds and revitalizes the body. Each sip is a blend of nature's restorative power and the land's inherent magic, accelerating the healing process.
DescriptionLore: As an action, you can drink this potion or administer it to another creature within reach. The drinker regains 2d4 + 2 hit points. The potion's crimson liquid glimmers with swirling golden motes.

Lore: Woven with enchantments passed down through generations of Ionian protectors, Stealth Wards stand as silent guardians. Cloaked in invisibility, they provide early warning of approaching threats, ensuring the sanctity of sacred grounds remains undisturbed.
DescriptionLore: As an action, you can plant this magical ward. The ward is invisible and lasts for 8 hours. The ward has AC 10, 1 hit point, and is immune to poison and psychic damage. A creature can use an action to attempt a DC 12 Wisdom (Perception) check to spot the ward. If the check succeeds, the ward becomes visible. While active, the ward alerts you if any creature comes within 30 feet of it. You are mentally alerted to the presence of a creature; you do not know what kind of creature it is.

Lore: A grotesque relic pulsating with Voidic energy. Crush it to briefly summon the Rift Herald, a monstrous aberration from the Void. However, beware – its presence leaves behind a lingering aura of corruption, testing the sanity and endurance of those nearby.
DescriptionLore: This grotesque eye pulses with dark energy. As an action, you can crush the eye, summoning a Rift Herald to a point you can see within 60 feet. The Rift Herald acts as an ally and obeys your commands. It uses the statistics of a Young Purple Worm, with the following changes: it is size Large, its type is aberration, and it has 60 hit points. The Rift Herald disappears after 1 minute, or when reduced to 0 hit points. Once the eye is crushed, the area within 30 feet of where it was crushed becomes filled with a tangible aura of void corruption for 1 hour. Any creature that starts its turn within this area must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 2d6 psychic damage and gain one level of exhaustion.

Lore: A magically replenishing pouch, favored amongst Bilgewater's less scrupulous denizens. After a successful hunt, it grants a share of the spoils, ensuring that even the lowliest crewmember gets 'their cut'.
DescriptionLore: This small pouch seems to magically refill itself. After you participate in defeating a creature with a challenge rating of 1 or higher, you gain a number of gold pieces equal to the creature's challenge rating (minimum of 1 gp). If the creature has no listed challenge rating, the DM determines an appropriate amount. This pouch can hold up to 100 gold pieces, and any excess gold is lost.

Lore: Woven with spirit threads and imbued with Ionian magic, these boots grant both speed and clarity. They sharpen the mind against manipulation and allow the wearer to unleash spells with uncanny speed, reflecting Ionia's pursuit of harmony and enlightenment.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 10 feet, and you have advantage on Wisdom saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per long rest, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can reduce the casting time to 1 action if the casting time is normally longer. Alternatively, if the spell has a casting time of 1 action, you may cast it as a bonus action.

Lore: Forged on Mount Targon, these boots adapt to the wearer's needs. Channeling celestial energy, they grant agility, sure footing, or the ability to defy gravity, allowing one to traverse even the most treacherous terrain with ease.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 10 feet. As a bonus action, you can adapt the soles to grant you one of the following benefits for 1 minute: advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks, the ability to walk on difficult terrain as if it were normal terrain, or the ability to climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check. Once you use this bonus action, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: A brutally efficient blade, prized by Noxian warriors. Imbued with dark magic, it amplifies strength, but its power comes at a cost. Drawing too deeply from its necrotic energy can leave the wielder weakened and vulnerable.
DescriptionLore: You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to have the attack deal an extra 3d6 necrotic damage. If you do so, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion.

Lore: A simple tool found throughout Ionia, favored by both villagers and martial acolytes. Some imbue these daggers with elemental energies, a practice common amongst novice practitioners seeking to hone their control.
DescriptionLore: This simple dagger is a +1 weapon. Once per day, as a bonus action, you can imbue the dagger with elemental energy, choosing acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage. The next attack you make with the dagger before the end of your turn deals an extra 1d6 damage of the chosen type.

Lore: Forged in the heart of the Immortal Bastion, Bami's Cinder retains a fraction of the raw power wielded by ancient fire mages. Its heat is said to echo the destructive ambitions of Noxus itself.
DescriptionLore: While holding this item, you are immune to fire damage. As an action, you can unleash a wave of heat in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once used, this property cannot be used again until the following dawn.

Lore: A fragment of celestial essence, resonating with the magic of Targon. It mends the wounds of those who channel the stars' power, allowing them to endure the trials of the mountain and beyond.
DescriptionLore: While holding this catalyst, you gain the following benefits: You gain resistance to radiant damage. Whenever you regain hit points from a spell or magical effect, you also regain a number of hit points equal to your proficiency bonus. Whenever you expend a spell slot, you regain 2d4 hit points.

Lore: A cruel blade favored by Noxian executioners and commanders. Its cursed edge inhibits the body's natural ability to recover, ensuring that even the smallest wound can prove fatal on the battlefield.
DescriptionLore: This wicked blade, when it hits a creature, prevents the target from regaining hit points until the start of your next turn. Additionally, the first time the target attempts to regain hit points before the start of your next turn, they must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion.
