Lore: Woven with strands reinforced by True Ice, Giant's Belts are worn by Freljordian warriors who face the bitter cold of the Howling Abyss. It grants them the strength to withstand the harshest blizzards and the mightiest foes.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this belt, your Strength score increases by 4, to a maximum of 24. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws against being moved or knocked prone. The belt has 3 charges. As a reaction when you would be subjected to forced movement you can expend a charge to negate the movement.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, the Hexdrinker is rumored to contain the essence of subjugated mages. Noxian officers often rely on its power to ward off magical assaults, a grim testament to the empire's brutal pragmatism.
DescriptionLore: While holding this weapon, you have advantage on saving throws against spells. If you take damage from a spell, you can use your reaction to absorb the magical energy. If you do so, you gain temporary hit points equal to the spell's level + your proficiency bonus. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: A relic of the nomadic tribes of the Freljord, this compass guides seekers through blizzards and across frozen wastes. It is said to lead to long-lost ruins and forgotten pathways touched by the ancient watchers.
DescriptionLore: While holding this compass, you always know which direction is north. Additionally, once per day, you can use an action to ask the compass to guide you to the nearest ruin or area of historical significance within 10 miles. The compass hums softly and the needle spins before settling on the direction of the chosen location. The guidance lasts for 1 hour, after which you must wait until the next dawn to use this ability again.

Lore: Honed in the arenas of Noxus, the Brutalizer is a weapon favored by those who seek to dominate. It inflicts lasting wounds, breaking both body and will, a reflection of the empire's merciless ambition.
DescriptionLore: This menacing weapon grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. On a hit, the wielder can choose to forgo dealing damage and instead inflict a stack of 'Brutalized' on the target (max 3 stacks). While Brutalized, the target has disadvantage on Dexterity and Wisdom saving throws. At the start of each of the target's turns, they can make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, removing one stack on a success. If the target reaches 3 stacks, they are also stunned until the end of their next turn.

Lore: Woven from petricite, this barrier hums with dormant magic, a shield against arcane assaults. Some believe it to be a lesser ward against mages, crafted in Demacia to repel forbidden magic.
DescriptionLore: This elegant shield is crafted from petricite, granting the wielder advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Once per day, as a reaction when you or an ally within 30 feet takes spell damage, you can grant resistance to that damage type to the target until the end of their next turn. This property of the shield can only be used to grant resistance to one damage type per day, chosen when the ability is activated.

Lore: Worn by disciples of the Kinkou, this amulet is a sign of their swiftness and dedication to balance. Its origins trace back to ancient Ionian monasteries, where the pursuit of enlightenment and speed are intertwined.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this amulet, your speed increases by 10 feet. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can Dash.

Lore: A marvel of Ixtali craft, the Axiom Arc channels the power of the Axiomata. Forged by a Yun Tal master, possibly a scion of the ruling caste, it unifies elemental energies. The Arc hums with the potential to reshape the world, granting its wielder profound control over magic, drawing upon Ixtal's deep understanding of the elements.
DescriptionLore: Forged through the intricate weaving of elemental forces, the Axiom Arc is a testament to Ixtal's mastery over the Axiomata. This artifact pulses with latent energy, awaiting a wielder attuned to the elemental threads of the world. While attuned to the Axiom Arc, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases by 1. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a spell, you can choose to regain an expended 3rd-level or lower spell slot. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can channel the Axiom Arc's power to cast one of the following spells without expending a spell slot: elemental weapon, protection from energy, or wall of fire. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest. The Axiom Arc is believed to be crafted by a prodigious member of the Yun Tal, possibly even the daughter of Ixtal's leader, who sought to encapsulate the essence of the Axiomata into a single formidable artifact. Its creation marked a pivotal moment in Ixtal's history, symbolizing the unification of elemental principles into a harmonious whole.

Lore: A cursed blade born from the anguish of a fallen king. The Blade of the Ruined King whispers promises of power, but it corrupts all who wield it. Its touch drains life, fueling the wielder's attacks with necrotic energy, binding them ever closer to the Ruination and the Black Mist that shrouds the Shadow Isles.
DescriptionLore: This corrupted longsword whispers of power and decay. On a hit, the blade deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. As a bonus action, you can attempt to steal the life force of a creature you have hit with this blade. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 4d6 necrotic damage and become charmed by you for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, you gain temporary hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest. While attuned to this blade, your alignment tends towards Chaotic Evil.

Lore: Forged from sunstone and imbued with echoes of the Ascended Host, the Bounty of Worlds is a relic of Shurima's golden age. Legend says it was crafted by a visionary mage seeking to rekindle the empire's former glory, drawing upon celestial power to reshape the desert sands and restore Shurima to its ascendant state.
DescriptionLore: N/A

Lore: A morbid bloom found within the Shadow Isles, thriving in the Black Mist. The Cryptbloom draws its life from the surrounding decay and death, exuding an aura that weakens the living. It is whispered to be a manifestation of the Ruination, a parasitic growth that feeds on souls and corrupts the very land itself.
DescriptionLore: N/A

Lore: Woven from starlight and celestial threads, the Dream Maker is a tool of the Aspect of Twilight. It is said to be a conduit for shaping dreams and altering destinies, its power subtly guided by Zoe's whimsical influence. With the Dream Maker, one can weave illusions, inspire hope, or even unravel the fabric of reality itself, all within the ethereal realm of dreams.
DescriptionLore: N/A

Lore: Forged by a master smith in the mountains of Ionia, the Essence Reaver hums with spiritual energy. It is said that those who wield it can tap into their inner reserves, turning a desperate blow into a surge of vitality. The blade seems to favor those who fight with heart, rewarding critical strikes with a burst of rejuvenating power.
DescriptionLore: This blade pulses with Ionian spirit energy. While attuned to this weapon, when you score a critical hit with it, you regain a number of hit points equal to the damage dice of the weapon. Additionally, once per long rest, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do, the blade emits a burst of energy, dealing 3d6 radiant damage to all creatures within 15 feet of you. You then gain temporary hit points equal to the radiant damage dealt.

Lore: An artifact of immense cold, the Frozen Heart is rumored to contain a fragment of ancient ice magic. Some believe it was once part of a Frostguard weapon, shattered long ago. Others whisper that a shard of Lissandra's own power is contained within, a chilling reminder of her dominion over the Freljord's frozen wastes.
DescriptionLore: This artifact radiates intense cold. While holding it, you have resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can unleash a wave of frost. Each creature in a 30-foot radius centered on you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d8 cold damage and its speed is reduced by half until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and its speed isn't reduced. After using this ability, the Frozen Heart becomes inert for 1d4 rounds, during which time you lose the resistance to cold damage.

Lore: A marvel of Piltover engineering, the Hextech Rocketbelt is the brainchild of an ambitious, albeit slightly reckless, inventor. Powered by volatile hextech crystals, it allows the wearer to execute rapid bursts of movement, leaving a trail of scorched earth in their wake. While undeniably effective, its safety record remains... questionable.
DescriptionLore: This belt is a marvel of Noxian engineering. As an action, you can activate the rocketbelt to propel yourself 30 feet in a straight line towards a direction you choose. Any creature within 5 feet of your destination must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 4d6 fire damage. You are considered to have cast a spell to activate the belt for the purposes of counterspell, and it requires a spell slot of 3rd level. Once activated, the belt cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: A massive maul favored by Bilgewater raiders and privateers. The Hullbreaker is designed to smash through defenses with brutal efficiency. Many a coastal settlement has fallen before its might. Its wielders often seek to bypass heavily guarded ports and raid isolated outposts with impunity. Legends say it was once wielded by a captain who brought down a leviathan using only the hammer.
DescriptionLore: This magical maul grants +3 to attack and damage rolls. While wielding this maul, you can cast the spell 'Knock' at will. Additionally, when you hit a structure (such as a door, wall, or siege engine) with this maul, you deal triple damage to it. Once per long rest, you can unleash a thunderous strike against a structure. Make an attack roll against the structure's AC. On a hit, the structure takes 5d10 thunder damage and must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or become vulnerable to all damage for 1 minute.

Lore: Forged in the docks of Bilgewater, the Kraken Slayer is a harpoon imbued with ancient magic, crafted for hunting the monstrous creatures of the deep. Those who wield it are said to possess an uncanny ability to pierce the hides of even the most colossal sea beasts, bringing terror to the krakens and other leviathans that lurk beneath the waves.
DescriptionLore: This +3 spear is particularly effective against creatures of the deep. You gain advantage on attack rolls against aberrations and monstrosities that have a swimming speed. When you hit such a creature with this spear, it takes an extra 3d6 piercing damage. Furthermore, once per day, you can cast the spell 'Control Water' without expending a spell slot. When used against a Kraken, the spear deals an additional 6d6 damage and the Kraken has disadvantage on its saving throw against 'Control Water'.

Lore: Forged in Demacia, this crossbow is named after Lord Dominik, a legendary figure known for his strategic brilliance in battles against heavily armored foes. Its bolts find purchase where others fail, a testament to Demacian ingenuity against overwhelming odds.
DescriptionLore: This +3 light crossbow ignores the Damage Resistance property of any creature. Furthermore, if you hit a creature with AC 18 or higher, that creature's AC is reduced by 1. This reduction lasts for 1 minute. The AC of a creature cannot be reduced below 18 in this way. In addition, you have advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are larger than you.

Lore: Wielded by desert nomads and Ascended warriors alike, the Mercurial Scimitar is imbued with ancient Shuriman magic. It deflects curses and madness, a beacon of resilience against the desolate wastes and the whispers of forgotten gods.
DescriptionLore: This scimitar, forged from Shuriman sands and ancient magic, grants advantage on saving throws against being cursed or suffering from debilitating magical effects. While wielding this weapon, you are immune to the frightened condition.

Lore: A chilling testament to Noxian pragmatism, the Mortal Reminder whispers promises of swift ends. Its edge weakens defenses, ensuring no armor can withstand the relentless onslaught, a grim tool favored by executioners and merciless duelists.
DescriptionLore: This Noxian blade whispers with malice. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or have their Armor Class reduced by 2 until the end of your next turn. This reduction can stack.

Lore: Woven with spirit magic by Ionian artisans, the Phantom Dancer grants its wearer unparalleled agility. It allows the user to flow through combat like a whisper, embodying the harmony of blade and spirit, favored by duelists and those who seek enlightenment through motion.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this blade, your walking speed increases by 15 feet, and you gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity saving throws. Additionally, as a reaction when you are hit by a melee attack, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You then have advantage on attack rolls against the triggering creature until the end of your next turn.

Lore: A marvel of Piltover engineering, the Rapid Firecannon channels arcane energy into each shot. It extends the reach of any marksman, turning calculated shots into strikes of electrifying force, a testament to Piltover's relentless pursuit of innovation in ranged weaponry.
DescriptionLore: This mystical longbow grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. In addition, the bowstring seems to hum with stored energy. As a bonus action, you can empower your next ranged attack with the bow to have its range doubled and deal an extra 2d6 force damage on a hit. This property can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expended uses recharge at dawn.

Lore: Whispers speak of a forgotten craft amongst the Winter's Claw. This sleigh, blessed by ancient ice magic, offers refuge from the harshest blizzards and wards off the whispers of the ice. Some say it was a gift from a long forgotten Ice Witch, designed to help travelers endure even the most brutal winters.
DescriptionLore: This intricately carved wooden sled radiates a faint aura of cold. While riding the Solstice Sleigh, you and up to two other Medium-sized creatures are immune to the effects of extreme cold, and you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As an action, you can command the sleigh to glide effortlessly over snow and ice at a speed of 60 feet for 1 hour. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Forged in the tempestuous heart of the First Lands, the Statikk Shiv channels raw lightning. Ionian storm mages believe it captures the essence of a summer storm, unleashing its stored energy in a single, devastating burst. Its unstable nature makes it dangerous for any but the most skilled to wield.
DescriptionLore: This magical weapon crackles with stored lightning. Once per long rest, as an action, you can unleash the Shiv's energy, targeting a point within 60 feet. Each creature within a 20-foot radius of that point must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 6d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, on a failed save, the target is stunned until the end of your next turn.

Lore: Touched by celestial energies on the slopes of Mount Targon, the Sundered Sky holds the power of the heavens. Warriors who wield it find themselves imbued with starlight, granting them both offensive might and a shield against their foes. Some believe it's a fragment of a fallen star, blessed by the Aspects themselves.
DescriptionLore: This weapon, blessed by celestial energies, allows you to channel the might of Targon. The first time you hit a creature with an attack on your turn, you can choose to deal an additional 4d8 radiant damage. If you do so, until the end of your next turn, you have advantage on attack rolls against that creature and the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

Lore: Essential for Demacian vanguard formations, the Trailblazer allows troops to swiftly traverse any terrain. Crafted with petricite and blessed by a Lightbringer, it creates a path of pure light, bolstering both speed and resilience. Many credit it with securing vital victories for Demacia's armies.
DescriptionLore: While holding this item, you can, as a bonus action, create a path of solidified light. This path is 10 feet wide and up to 30 feet long, originating from you. The path remains for 1 minute. While on the path, you and any friendly creatures gain +10 feet to your movement speed and have advantage on saving throws against being knocked prone. You can use this ability once per long rest.

Lore: A cornerstone of Demacian vigilance, the Vigilant Wardstone enhances perception and reveals hidden threats. Used by sentinels guarding the borders, it allows them to see beyond the veil, detecting ambushes and magical concealments. It is a symbol of Demacia's unwavering dedication to safety and protection.
DescriptionLore: This stone pulses with a soft, inner light. While holding the Vigilant Wardstone, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks related to detecting hidden creatures or objects within 60 feet. Additionally, you can cast the *See Invisibility* spell once per day. The stone regains its ability to cast this spell at dawn.

Lore: A pendant crafted from True Ice, colder than the fiercest blizzard. Freljordian shamans claim it offers protection against the chilling whispers of the Watchers and the numbing touch of the Void.
DescriptionLore: This item appears as a simple pendant made from a shard of true ice, perpetually cold to the touch. While wearing Winter's Approach, you have resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can unleash a wave of intense cold in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 8d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. After using this ability, the pendant becomes inert until the next dawn.

Lore: A shard of Voidborn crystal, pulsating with alien energy. Whispers claim it was used to detect and manipulate the minds of mortals during the ancient conflicts, a tool of infiltration and control.
DescriptionLore: This twisted, obsidian spike hums with an unsettling energy. While holding the Realmspike, you can cast the *Detect Magic* spell at will. Additionally, as an action, you can target one creature within 60 feet and force them to make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the creature is also vulnerable to psychic damage. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

Lore: A harpoon blessed by Nagakabouros, the Mother Serpent. Buhru sea hunters use it in rituals to appease or control colossal sea beasts, ensuring safe passage through treacherous waters.
DescriptionLore: This wickedly barbed harpoon is a relic of the Buhru tribe, said to be blessed by Nagakabouros. Once per day, as an action, you can hurl Death's Daughter at a creature within 60 feet. Make a ranged attack roll. On a hit, the target takes 3d8 piercing damage and must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 30 feet toward you. If the target is a beast of size Large or larger, it has disadvantage on the saving throw.

Lore: Forged in the dying breath of a celestial body, some whisper that the Black Hole Gauntlet is a relic of a forgotten Aspect, a fragment of cosmic power capable of bending space itself.
DescriptionLore: This gauntlet pulses with an unnatural darkness. While wearing the Black Hole Gauntlet, you gain a +2 bonus to AC. As an action, you can activate the gauntlet to create a miniature black hole at a point within 30 feet that you can see. Each creature within 10 feet of the point must make a DC 17 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d10 force damage and is pulled 5 feet toward the center. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled. The black hole collapses after one round. Once this property is used, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Crafted in the darkest forges of Noxus, these talons are said to be infused with the captured souls of conquered enemies, granting their wielder brutal strength and a whisper of their victims' power. The Black Rose covets such artifacts.
DescriptionLore: These razor-sharp talons are crafted from darksteel and imbued with a fragment of trapped souls. While worn, your unarmed strikes deal 1d8 slashing damage. As a bonus action, you can expend 1 soul to deal an additional 2d6 necrotic damage and gain advantage on your next attack roll. These talons can hold a maximum of 5 souls. When you reduce a humanoid to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to trap its soul within the talons, granting the talons 1 soul. Souls fade from the talons at dawn.

Lore: A volatile creation from the depths of Zaun, the Detonation Orb harnesses unstable alchemical reactions for devastating explosions. Favored by demolitionists and those seeking indiscriminate destruction, its power comes at the cost of utter annihilation after a single use.
DescriptionLore: This orb pulses with crimson energy. As an action, you can hurl the Detonation Orb up to 60 feet. Upon impact, the orb explodes in a 20-foot radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 fire damage and 8d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of effect that is reduced to 0 hit points by this damage is disintegrated. Once used, the orb turns to ash.

Lore: Forged in shadows, the Duskblade whispers to assassins across Runeterra. It grants the wielder the element of surprise, allowing them to strike from the darkness and exploit vulnerabilities with chilling efficiency. A tool for those who prefer to operate unseen.
DescriptionLore: This blade hums with shadows. Once per long rest, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force them to make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is Blinded and Deafened until the end of your next turn, and you gain advantage on attack rolls against that creature until the end of your next turn. Additionally, the first time you hit a creature with this weapon after emerging from being hidden or invisible, the attack deals an extra 4d6 necrotic damage.

Lore: A cruelly crafted weapon from Noxus, the Flesheater hungers for blood. It rewards brutality with stolen vitality, empowering its wielder with the life force of their fallen foes. A symbol of dominance and the insatiable thirst for power.
DescriptionLore: This weapon thirsts for blood. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. If you do, you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. Additionally, if you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour.

Lore: Once the prized possession of 'The River King,' a notorious Bilgewater card shark, this blade crackles with unpredictable energy. It embodies the chaotic nature of chance, offering immense power at the risk of utter failure. A true gambler's weapon.
DescriptionLore: This +2 shortsword, once owned by the infamous card shark 'The River King', hums with chaotic energy. Once per long rest, when you make an attack roll with this weapon, you can choose to gamble. Roll a d20. On a 1-10, the attack automatically misses and you take 1d6 psychic damage. On an 11-20, the attack automatically hits and deals an extra 4d6 force damage.

Lore: A symbol of balance and discipline, the Kinkou Jitte is a treasured artifact of the Kinkou Order. It aids in maintaining inner harmony and protecting allies from harm, embodying the unwavering dedication to preserving equilibrium in Ionia.
DescriptionLore: This +1 jitte grants advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As a reaction when you or an ally within 30 feet is hit by an attack, you can redirect the chi flowing through the jitte, imposing disadvantage on the attack roll. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Wrought in the heart of the Shadow Isles, this scythe hungers for life. Each fallen foe empowers the wielder with a fragment of stolen vitality, a grim echo of the Black Mist's endless consumption.
DescriptionLore: This +2 scythe deals an additional 2d6 necrotic damage on a hit. Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. Additionally, once per day, you can cast the 'Enervation' spell (save DC 15) without expending a spell slot or material components.

Lore: A scythe used by spectral reapers during the Harrowing. With each soul claimed, the blade grows stronger, echoing the unending hunger of the Shadow Isles.
DescriptionLore: While holding this reaper's scythe, you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. In addition, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you can choose to trap its soul. The creature's soul is transferred to the scythe, and you can use a bonus action to release the soul, causing the scythe to deal an extra 6d6 necrotic damage on its next successful hit within 1 minute. The scythe can hold up to 3 souls at a time. When the scythe contains 3 souls, you can cast the 'Soul Cage' spell (no components required) as an action, consuming the souls in the scythe.

Lore: Forged under the celestial gaze of Mount Targon, this blade whispers of divine power. Those who dare wield it risk being consumed by a fleeting glimpse of the heavens.
DescriptionLore: This longsword hums with celestial energy. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. Once per day, as a bonus action, you can invoke the divine aspect within the sword for 1 minute. While the aspect is invoked, you gain the following benefits: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack using this sword, you can deal an extra 3d8 radiant damage to the target. At the end of the minute, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Crafted in the secluded temples of Ionia, this bow embodies precision and inner peace. A true marksman finds balance not only in their aim, but also within themselves.
DescriptionLore: This exquisitely crafted longbow is always perfectly balanced in your hands. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. In addition, you gain the following benefits while wielding this bow: Your ranged weapon attacks ignore half and three-quarters cover. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with this bow, you can reroll one of the damage dice, choosing which result to use. As a bonus action, you can enter a state of heightened focus for 1 minute. While focused, your critical hit range with this bow is increased by 1 (to a maximum of 17-20).

Lore: Blessed on the slopes of Mount Targon, this amulet offers solace against celestial wrath. A beacon of protection for those who dare to ascend.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this amulet, you gain advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that deal radiant damage or originate from celestial beings. Additionally, once per day, when you would be reduced to 0 hit points by radiant damage, you are instead reduced to 1 hit point.

Lore: A marvel of Hextech engineering, the Gunblade seamlessly merges arcane power with martial prowess. Favored by those who seek to bridge magic and technology, it offers both devastating attacks and life-stealing capabilities. Its creation is attributed to a collaboration between Piltover's finest artificers and Zaun's daring experimenters.
DescriptionLore: This magical weapon grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend a spell slot to deal an additional 1d8 force damage per level of the spell slot. In addition, you regain a number of hit points equal to half the force damage dealt. If you expend a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the target must also succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of your next turn.

Lore: Whispered to be forged from a fragment of a fallen Aspect, the Wordless Promise binds the fates of two champions. It allows the bearer to share in the suffering of an ally, strengthening their bond through shared sacrifice and bolstering their combined resolve against the trials of Targon.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this amulet, when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to transfer half of that damage to yourself. You can't reduce this transferred damage in any way. Additionally, when you are reduced to half your hit point maximum or lower, you and one willing creature within 30 feet of you both gain temporary hit points equal to your level in this class. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: Woven with enchanted threads and imbued with the spirit of swiftness, Alacrity grants its wearer unmatched agility. These boots whisper forgotten techniques of Ionian martial arts, allowing for lightning-fast reflexes and unparalleled grace in the dance of combat. Favored by duelists and those who value speed above all else.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 15 feet, and you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that you can see, such as traps and spells. In addition, as a bonus action, you can spend 1 Hit Die to gain advantage on your next attack roll or Dexterity check before the end of your turn.

Lore: This intricate device, a marvel of Piltover ingenuity, is used to detect hidden magic. Utilizing principles reverse-engineered from ancient Shuriman artifacts, the Arcane Sweeper allows its user to unveil illusions, expose magical traps, and pierce through the veil of the unseen. Often used by wardens and investigators.
DescriptionLore: This handheld device has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to cast Detect Magic in a 60-foot cone. Additionally, you can use a bonus action to expend 1 charge and make a DC 15 Intelligence (Investigation) check to pinpoint the exact location of the nearest magical trap or illusion within 30 feet. The sweeper regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Demacia, Atma's Impaler embodies the virtues of fortitude and unwavering resolve. It enhances the wearer's resilience against fear and charm, while also converting their inner strength into devastating blows. A symbol of Demacian resilience, worn by those who stand firm against the odds.
DescriptionLore: You gain a +3 bonus to AC and saving throws against effects that would inflict the frightened or charmed condition. Additionally, you gain a bonus to damage rolls equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1).

Lore: A wickedly sharp blade rumored to whisper promises of untold riches. Favored by ambitious captains and ruthless buccaneers of Bilgewater, it's said to lead its wielder to ever greater hauls, though at a considerable cost to their soul.
DescriptionLore: This magical blade grants you advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are carrying gold or other valuable items. In addition, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you may choose to immediately search their person for any gold or other valuables; if you do, you regain 1d6 hit points.

Lore: Reaped from the Shadow Isles, this scythe is infused with the Black Mist. It hungers for souls, leaving a trail of chilling dread in its wake. Whispers claim it amplifies the user's presence, turning intimidation into an art form—a terrifying boon granted by the Ruination itself.
DescriptionLore: This scythe deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage to any target it hits. Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, a wisp of black mist erupts from their body and swirls around you. For the next minute, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks.

Lore: A rare alchemical concoction favored by Demacia's elite Mageseekers. This potion allows for immediate extraction from the field, returning the user to a pre-designated sanctuary for rest, resupply, or strategic reassessment. Each pill is uniquely attuned to its user and location, and cannot be transferred.
DescriptionLore: Potion, very rare. When you drink this potion, you teleport to a safe location that you designate when you create the potion. This location must be within the same plane of existence as you and must be familiar to you. The potion has no effect if you are not on the same plane of existence as the designated location. Once designated, the location cannot be changed.

Lore: Woven with resilient spirit threads, these gloves are a symbol of Ionian resilience. They are said to empower the wearer with the strength to endure even the most crushing blows, offering a second chance born of sheer willpower. Champions in the fighting pits often seek these for their legendary aid.
DescriptionLore: Wondrous Item, rare (requires attunement). While wearing these gloves, your unarmed strikes deal 1d8 bludgeoning damage. Additionally, once per day when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do so, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. You cannot use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: A legendary greatsword forged in the fires of Noxus. Whispers speak of its insatiable hunger for conquest and the price of wielding such power. Each strike leaves a mark that weakens body and soul, a grim reminder of Noxus's brutal path to dominance. Some say it was once wielded by a general who conquered half the continent, before the blade consumed him.
DescriptionLore: Weapon (greatsword), legendary (requires attunement). You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Noxian Might: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 3d6 necrotic damage to the target. If you do, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion. The necrotic damage cannot be applied to constructs or undead.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon by the Aspect of Wisdom's disciples, the Celestial Eye pierces the veil, granting glimpses of future possibilities and revealing hidden truths to those who seek enlightenment.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this artifact, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks and Intelligence (Investigation) checks. Additionally, once per long rest, you can cast the Augury spell without expending a spell slot.

Lore: A vile concoction brewed in the depths of Zaun, the Chemtech Putrifier spreads virulent toxins that weaken and corrode the enemy. A favored tool for those seeking to gain an advantage through insidious means.
DescriptionLore: This noxious vial contains enough material for three uses. As an action, you can hurl the vial up to 30 feet. On impact, the vial bursts, and each creature within a 10-foot radius must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, at the start of each of their turns, the poisoned creatures take 2d6 poison damage.

Lore: Woven with starlight by the Solari, this cloak offers resilience against the terrors of the night. It is a beacon of hope, a shield against the encroaching darkness that threatens to consume all.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this cloak, you have resistance to radiant damage and advantage on saving throws against effects that would turn you undead. As a reaction when you are hit by an attack, you can cause the attacker to be blinded until the end of its next turn.

Lore: Hewn from true ice and filled with water from a pure glacial spring, this flask offers restorative properties reminiscent of ancient Freljordian magic. It is a tool for hardy explorers traversing the frozen wastes.
DescriptionLore: This flask, hewn from glacial ice, contains a perpetually cool liquid. As an action, you can drink the flask's contents and regain 2d4 hit points. The flask magically refills with water after one minute if it is not inside an enclosed container. The flask can only be used three times, after which the restorative properties of the flask fade and it becomes a mundane, albeit beautiful, object.

Lore: A conduit for dark sorcery, the Deathfire Grasp whispers promises of immense power, but demands a terrible price. It is a relic of forgotten Shadow Isles rituals, capable of trapping the souls of the unwary.
DescriptionLore: Wand, very rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster). This twisted wand crackles with dark energy. You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls while holding this wand. As an action, you can expend 3 charges to unleash a burst of necrotic energy at one creature within 60 feet. The target must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 8d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this wand's effect has its soul trapped within the wand. The wand has 7 charges, and it regains 1d4+3 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ash, releasing any trapped souls.

Lore: A weapon steeped in the hungering magic of the Shadow Isles. Each fallen foe fuels its insatiable need, empowering the wielder with stolen life force. But beware, for the Devourer demands a constant stream of souls, lest it turn its ravenous gaze upon its master. Some say it whispers promises of ultimate power, echoing from the ruined halls of forgotten Shadow Isles conquerors.
DescriptionLore: Weapon (any), legendary (requires attunement). This weapon pulses with a ravenous hunger. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. On a hit, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to the creature's maximum hit points. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. While attuned to this weapon, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw at dawn each day or become cursed. While cursed, you are compelled to feed the weapon souls. You have disadvantage on all saving throws made to resist this compulsion. If you go 7 days without feeding the weapon a soul, you take 10d6 necrotic damage as the weapon feeds on your life force.

Lore: An ancient ring, said to have belonged to a wandering mage in Ionia, seeks a wielder strong in spirit. It is said to grant a clearer perception of the spirit realm, guiding the wearer through the veil and empowering their connection to the unseen energies of the land. But the spirit world is seldom silent, and some whisper that prolonged use can blur the line between realities.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this ring, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases by 1. Additionally, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to interact with spirits or creatures from other planes of existence.

Lore: Forged in Ionia, the Edge of Finality whispers of the Spirit Blossom Festival and the spirits who linger on the edge of life. Its blade sings with the echoes of souls passed, capable of trapping the essence of the recently departed. Unleashing such a soul grants immense power, but at the risk of inviting unwanted attention from beyond the veil.
DescriptionLore: This magical longsword deals an extra 2d8 force damage on a hit. Once per day, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you can choose to trap its soul within the blade. While a soul is trapped, you can use a bonus action to unleash it, dealing 6d8 force damage to a target within 30 feet. The soul is then released.

Lore: A staple concoction among Noxian arena fighters, the Elixir of Fortitude offers a fleeting glimpse of invincibility. Brewed with potent, and often volatile, ingredients, it grants unmatched resilience and strength for a short time, allowing gladiators to endure the most brutal onslaughts. But the price of such power is steep, leaving the imbiber weakened and vulnerable once its effects fade, testing their true strength.
DescriptionLore: For the next minute after drinking this elixir, you are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. After the minute ends, you gain one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Forged with the combined light of the sun and moon of Mount Targon, the Equinox emits both celestial power and an uncanny balance. It is said to offer protection from both mental and physical influences, and to unleash a burst of pure celestial energy, drawing upon the strength of the sun and moon to banish shadows and embolden the righteous. However, wielding it requires unwavering devotion and a connection to the cosmic energies of Targon.
DescriptionLore: This mysterious artifact pulses with the combined energy of the sun and moon. While holding the Equinox, you gain advantage on saving throws against being blinded or frightened. Additionally, once per dawn or dusk, you can unleash a burst of celestial energy, dealing 3d6 radiant damage to all creatures within a 15-foot radius. The damage is halved for creatures that succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw.

Lore: An artifact pulsating with the sun's power. Legend says the Eye was used by the Ascended to test potential warriors, granting immense strength to those who prove worthy, but punishing the weak with agonizing transformation.
DescriptionLore: This ancient Shuriman relic holds the potential to unlock your inner Ascended. As an action, you can touch the Eye of Ascension and make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a success, you gain the benefits of the 'enlarge' portion of the Enlarge/Reduce spell for 1 hour, and your skin takes on a sun-kissed bronze hue. On a failure, you are stunned until the end of your next turn as the Eye attempts to reshape you. If you attempt this transformation again within 7 days, the DC increases by 2.

Lore: Forged by the Solari, this relic embodies the sun's protective grace. It wards against darkness and those who wield corrupted light, offering solace and resilience to the faithful.
DescriptionLore: A relic of the Solari, this item radiates a comforting warmth. While holding the Eye of the Equinox, you gain a +2 bonus to AC against ranged attacks that deal radiant damage. As a reaction when you or an ally within 30 feet is hit by such an attack, you can expend 1 charge to grant resistance to radiant damage to the target of the attack until the end of their next turn. The Eye has 3 charges, and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: A shield blessed upon Mount Targon, the Face of the Mountain stands as an unwavering bulwark. It is said to be imbued with the strength of the mountain itself, offering refuge to allies in their direst hour.
DescriptionLore: While holding this shield, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. As a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can grant them temporary hit points equal to your level in that class. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Woven with spirit magic by reclusive Ionian monks, the Flicker allows one to dance between worlds. Each blink brings disorientation, but offers the potential to escape danger and disorient foes.
DescriptionLore: This amulet allows you to cast the Misty Step spell at will. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 15 feet. If you do so, the next attack roll made against you before the end of your next turn has disadvantage.

Lore: A diadem radiating glacial power. Some say it belonged to a forgotten Ice Witch, capable of conjuring spectral apparitions to ensnare and slow enemies with chilling magic. It whispers promises of dominion over the frozen wastes.
DescriptionLore: This spectral diadem allows you to cast the 'Hold Person' spell once per long rest without expending a spell slot. Furthermore, as an action, you can summon two spectral apparitions that appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of you. These apparitions have a speed of 30 feet and can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. As a bonus action on your turn, you can command one apparition to attempt to slow a creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or have its speed halved until the end of its next turn. The apparitions disappear after 1 minute or if reduced to 0 hit points (they have 1 hit point each).

Lore: Forged by the Frostguard, this gauntlet allows its wearer to channel the chilling power of the Frozen Watchers. Each strike carries the bite of the tundra, slowing foes and granting resilience against the biting cold. A favored weapon of Lissandra's most devoted followers, it echoes with the whispers of glacial magic.
DescriptionLore: This gauntlet, when worn, grants you resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can unleash a cone of frost extending 15 feet from you. Creatures in the cone must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 4d6 cold damage and have their speed reduced by half until the end of their next turn. You can use this ability three times, regaining all expended uses after a long rest. While attuned to this item, you can cast the 'Armor of Agathys' spell once per long rest, without expending a spell slot.

Lore: Woven from the heart of a howling blizzard, this shroud offers protection against the harshest Freljordian winters. Legends speak of ancient frost giants who gifted these shrouds to those who could withstand their chilling presence, granting the power to command the very storms themselves. Only the Iceborn are strong enough to control it.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this shroud, you are immune to the effects of extreme cold and gain advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that deal cold damage. In addition, once per day, as an action, you can summon a blizzard in a 20-foot radius centered on you. The blizzard lasts for 1 minute, heavily obscuring the area and imposing disadvantage on ranged attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. At the end of each of your turns while the blizzard persists, each creature within the area takes 2d6 cold damage.

Lore: Crafted by Ionian shadow masters, this totem enhances the wearer's ability to blend with the environment. Planted in the earth, it extends its veil of secrecy to allies, allowing for silent passage through even the most guarded locations. It is often used by the Kinkou during missions of peace and preservation.
DescriptionLore: While holding this totem, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. As an action, you can plant the totem in the ground. For the next hour, any creature within 30 feet of the totem gains the benefits of the Pass Without Trace spell. Once this effect ends, the totem crumbles to dust and is destroyed.

Lore: This blade is said to contain the essence of a long-lost Ice Witch, forever seeking a worthy champion. Each strike freezes the target, and a fatal blow can trap them in ice for eternity. The blade hums with the promise of power, yet whispers of a chilling fate await those who wield it for too long. Only an Iceborn should wield such power.
DescriptionLore: You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic longsword. When you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or become encased in ice. While encased, the creature is restrained and has vulnerability to fire damage. At the end of each of its turns, the encased creature can repeat the saving throw, freeing itself on a success. On a critical hit, the target is permanently frozen solid.

Lore: Salvaged from a sunken temple dedicated to Nagakabouros, this amulet resonates with the spirit of fortune. Favored by Bilgewater captains and daring treasure hunters, it is said to guide its wearer to hidden riches and sweeten deals with even the most hardened pirates, ensuring the tides of fortune forever flow in their favor.
DescriptionLore: While you wear this amulet, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks and Charisma (Persuasion) checks made when interacting with merchants or pirates. Additionally, once per day, you can cast the Locate Object spell. When you cast the spell in this way, you only locate gold coins or items made of gold. While attuned to the heart of gold, once per week, you can choose to have up to 1000 gold pieces magically appear in your hand.

Lore: A marvel of Zaunite engineering, the Hex Core is a modular device designed to augment and enhance mechanical and biological systems. Favored by innovators seeking the 'Glorious Evolution', it allows for radical experimentation and adaptation, pushing the boundaries of what is possible... and safe.
DescriptionLore: This arcane device hums with untapped potential. As an action, you can attach the Hex Core to a willing construct, or humanoid creature that has mechanical body parts. The target gains a +2 bonus to their AC, and they gain resistance to either lightning or poison damage (their choice). Additionally, they can cast the Shocking Grasp cantrip at will, and can use an action to cast the Lightning Bolt spell (3rd level) once per day. Once per week, the attuned creature can use an action to cast the Animate Objects spell.

Lore: An early example of Piltover's Hextech innovation, the Revolver channels arcane energy through refined crystals, offering a versatile means of magical offense. While later designs prioritized safety and efficiency, the Revolver remains a potent, if somewhat volatile, artifact of a bygone era.
DescriptionLore: This arcane focus, once wielded by Noxian artificers, hums with latent magical energy. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to cast the Shocking Grasp cantrip (save DC 13) or expend 3 charges to cast Magic Missile as a 1st level spell. The revolver has 7 charges and regains 1d4+3 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the revolver shatters into inert fragments.

Lore: Brewed from rare herbs and monster extracts found in the harsh Freljordian wilderness, this potion aids hunters and foragers in surviving the long, unforgiving winters. It sharpens the senses and provides a surge of vitality when facing the beasts that roam the frozen tundra.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this potion, you regain 2d4+2 hit points. For the next hour, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track creatures, and on attack rolls against beasts and monstrosities whose challenge rating is equal to or less than your level. The effects end early if you take damage from a creature that is not a beast or monstrosity.

Lore: A forbidden concoction brewed in the darkest corners of Noxus, the Ichor of Rage amplifies aggression and raw power at a terrible cost. Consumed by gladiators seeking an edge in the arena or warriors embracing brutal efficiency, it leaves the imbiber weakened and vulnerable after the fury subsides.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this viscous, crimson fluid, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute: You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. When you make a melee weapon attack using Strength, you gain a +3 bonus to the damage roll (included in the attack). At the end of each of your turns, you take 3 (1d6) necrotic damage that cannot be reduced in any way. Afterwards, you gain one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Woven with ancient Ionian spirit magic, the Ionic Spark was once used to defend sacred groves from encroaching darkness. Though time has faded its potency, the Spark still crackles with protective energy, warding off those who dare to trespass.
DescriptionLore: While holding this weapon, you can use a bonus action to activate the Spark, causing it to emit a crackling aura of energy for 1 minute. While the aura is active, any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of you takes 1d6 lightning damage. The Spark can be used three times, and regains all expended uses at dawn.

Lore: A gambler's charm from Bilgewater, said to sway fate. Many swear it whispers secrets of fortune, though most end up losing more than they win.
DescriptionLore: While you possess this item, you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to resist being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per day, when you make an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can choose to treat the roll as a 20.

Lore: Wrought in Ionia, this blade whispers of forgotten hemomancy. It feeds on life, granting vitality to its wielder at the cost of their foes. Some say it thirsts for balance, others for vengeance.
DescriptionLore: This magical weapon deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage on a hit. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you regain hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. Once per long rest, as a reaction when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do so, the next attack you make with this weapon before the end of your next turn has advantage and deals an extra 3d6 necrotic damage.

Lore: Forged within the Immortal Bastion, this horrifying artifact drains the life force of any creature nearby. Legends say it corrupts the soul, leaving its victims as empty husks, forever bound to its insatiable hunger.
DescriptionLore: This terrifying artifact pulses with dark energy. While holding the Leeching Leer, you can use a bonus action to target one creature within 30 feet that you can see. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 5d6 necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and you regain no hit points. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until the start of your next turn. In addition, any creature that touches the Leeching Leer takes 2d6 necrotic damage. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by the Leeching Leer has its life essence completely drained away and cannot be revived by any means short of a wish spell.

Lore: A symbol of Demacian craftsmanship, this bow is favored by elite trackers and sentinels. Its arrows fly true, empowered by the light of Demacia, ensuring justice prevails with every shot.
DescriptionLore: This exquisitely crafted longbow is a masterwork of Demacian craftsmanship. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, once per turn when you hit a creature with this bow, you can choose to deal an extra 2d6 radiant damage to the target and the next attack roll against the target before the end of your next turn has advantage.

Lore: A colossal greatsword forged in Bilgewater, steeped in the magic of the sea. Legends claim it was wielded by a kraken priest, dominating the oceans and crushing all who dared challenge its reign.
DescriptionLore: This colossal greatsword radiates the power of the deep sea. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend a charge to unleash a wave of seawater dealing an additional 4d8 cold damage and pushing the target 10 feet away. This weapon has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. While wielding this weapon, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and you can breathe underwater.

Lore: Forged in the shadow of Mount Targon, this pendant is imbued with celestial resilience. Whispers say it draws power from the Living Flame, offering solace and vitality to those who carry it through the harshest trials.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this pendant, you have advantage on saving throws against exhaustion and resistance to cold and fire damage. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can touch the pendant to regain hit points equal to 1d8 + your Constitution modifier. Once you use this bonus action, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: A masterwork of Demacian craftsmanship, Lord Dominik's Regards is a testament to unwavering resolve. Forged to honor a champion who stood against overwhelming odds, it empowers its wielder to pierce even the most formidable defenses, a beacon of hope against encroaching darkness.
DescriptionLore: This legendary weapon grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When you hit a creature with this weapon, and that creature's AC is 18 or higher, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 radiant damage. If the target is wearing heavy armor, the extra damage increases to 3d6 radiant damage. Once per long rest, you can use a bonus action to call forth the sun's blessing, granting you advantage on attack rolls against armored opponents for 1 minute.

Lore: Augmented by arcane technology in Piltover's most advanced workshops, Luden's Echo hums with latent energy. It amplifies the wielder's spells, unleashing cascading echoes of arcane power that reverberate through the battlefield.
DescriptionLore: This arcane focus grants a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals damage, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the spell's damage is echoed, dealing an extra 2d6 force damage to one additional target within 30 feet of the original target. The extra target is chosen by you. This additional damage can only occur once per casting of a spell.

Lore: A gruesome innovation from the depths of Zaun, Madred's Bloodrazor thirsts for vital essence. Forged with hemomantic science and unstable technology, it drains the life force of its victims, leaving a trail of withering decay in its wake.
DescriptionLore: This weapon pulses with dark energy. Once per long rest, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 6d6 necrotic damage. If the creature has blood, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its maximum hit points are reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. A creature is immune if it doesn't have blood or is undead.

Lore: Born from the tormented souls of the Shadow Isles, Malady whispers promises of power through corruption. It twists minds and bodies, offering a seductive path to dominance fueled by the anguish of the damned.
DescriptionLore: This cursed item radiates an aura of unease. When a creature attunes to Malady, they must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become afflicted with a madness. While attuned, the user has advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks, but disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks. Additionally, once per day, the wielder can cast the spell 'Inflict Wounds' as a 5th-level spell, requiring no material components.

Lore: A gnarled wooden ward pulsing with necromantic energy, harvested from the twisted forests of the Shadow Isles. When planted, it evokes the primal fears of those nearby, a tool favored by those who command the dead and revel in terror.
DescriptionLore: This gnarled wooden ward pulses with necromantic energy. As an action, you can plant the Mandrake Ward in the ground. For the next hour, all creatures within a 30-foot radius must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect for 24 hours. The ward crumbles to dust after an hour or after being successfully dispelled.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, the Maw whispers promises of resilience in the face of death. But its power comes at a cost. Those who rely on it risk succumbing to a growing darkness, their will slowly eroded by the abyss it contains.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this weapon, you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do so, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level in the class that granted you the most recent level. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. Once this effect is triggered, it cannot be used again until you complete a long rest. However, after each long rest, roll a d20. On a result of 1, you must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion.

Lore: A beautifully crafted scimitar rumored to have been blessed by the Serpent Isles. Seafarers prize it for its ability to ward off curses and banish the influence of the undead, a necessity in the shadow-haunted waters of Bilgewater.
DescriptionLore: This +2 scimitar has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to cast the Dispel Magic spell (DC 15). In addition, while you wield this scimitar, you have advantage on saving throws against curses and effects that would turn you into an undead creature. The scimitar regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Forged in Ionia, this blade embodies the spirit of illusion and deception. It dances in the light, creating phantasms that confound enemies and allow its wielder to fade seamlessly into the shadows, a favorite of Ionian tricksters.
DescriptionLore: This +1 shortsword has 3 charges. As a bonus action, you can expend 1 charge to cast the Mirror Image spell. While wielding this blade, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in lightly obscured areas. The shortsword regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Touched by the celestial light of Targon, the Moonstone Renewer radiates restorative energy. It channels the moon's gentle power, mending wounds and bolstering allies, a beacon of hope in the darkest night, reflecting the grace of the celestial Aspect.
DescriptionLore: While holding this Moonstone Renewer, you can use a bonus action to touch a creature within 30 feet. That creature regains hit points equal to 3d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn. Additionally, whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points to a creature, you can choose a different creature within 30 feet of the target. The chosen creature regains hit points equal to 1d6.

Lore: Said to contain the echoes of forgotten rituals, the Murksphere radiates a palpable dread. It is rumored to hold a fragment of a powerful wraith, forever bound to the orb, unleashing its terror upon those who dare to wield it.
DescriptionLore: This orb pulses with an unnatural darkness. As an action, you can hurl the Murksphere at a point within 60 feet. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a failed save, a creature also takes 3d6 psychic damage. Once this property is used, the Murksphere becomes nonmagical for 24 hours.

Lore: Forged in the fires of undeath, the Night Harvester thirsts for the essence of the living. Each strike steals vitality, leaving behind a chilling void. Those who wield it risk becoming tethered to the spectral realm, forever haunted by the spirits it consumes.
DescriptionLore: This dark blade hungers for life force. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, the creature takes an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. If the creature is reduced to 0 hit points by this attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. Additionally, once per long rest, when you are reduced to half your hit point maximum or lower, you can regain hit points equal to 4d8 + your Constitution modifier. After using this feature, you gain one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Crafted from the heartwood of a frost-touched tree, the Noonquiver whispers of ancient hunts. Its arrows bite with the chill of the tundra, favored by those who stalk the frozen wastes for monstrous prey.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this quiver, you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with ranged weapons that use ammunition drawn from it. In addition, as a bonus action, you can imbue up to three arrows drawn from the quiver with frost. When an arrow imbued this way hits a creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn. On a failed save, the creature also suffers disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn if it attempts to move before then.

Lore: A blade whispered to be blessed by a hemomancer. 'Opportunity' grants its wielder the precision to strike when their enemies are most vulnerable. Its edge promises a swift end, cloaked in shadows and fueled by dark intent, leaving no trace behind.
DescriptionLore: This dagger grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. Additionally, once per turn, if you have advantage on an attack roll against a creature, you can choose to deal an extra 14 (4d6) necrotic damage to the target. If you do so, you gain advantage on Stealth checks until the end of your next turn as dark shadows obscure your movements.

Lore: Forged in the celestial light of Mount Targon, the Oracle's Lens pierces through illusion and reveals hidden truths. Pilgrims and Seekers use it to navigate the mountain's veiled paths, uncovering secrets obscured from mortal eyes.
DescriptionLore: While holding this lens, you can use a bonus action to cast the Detect Magic spell. The lens has 3 charges, and it regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. Additionally, when you cast the Detect Magic spell using this lens, you can also choose to cast See Invisibility as part of the same action, consuming one additional charge.

Lore: Worn by masters of the blade in Ionia, the Phantom Dancer enhances both agility and reflexes. Those who wear it move with uncanny grace, becoming a blur to their opponents, a dance of steel and shadow that is both deadly and beautiful. It is said the most skilled blades know how to weave the spirit realm with each step.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this vestment, your Dexterity score increases by 2, to a maximum of 22. It also grants you the following benefits: You gain a +2 bonus to AC. When you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to become invisible until the end of your next turn. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn. Your movement speed increases by 10 feet. If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Lore: Forged in the ice-rimmed forges of the Frostguard, these enchanted pickaxes are said to be used to extract True Ice from the glaciers of the Freljord. Some believe weapons crafted from True Ice can wound even gods, though its secrets are closely guarded by the Ice Witch.
DescriptionLore: This magical pickaxe grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made against objects and structures. When used to mine any metal, the wielder gains advantage on checks made to determine the quality and quantity of the mined ore. Against creatures composed of ice or cold, this pickaxe deals an additional 2d6 fire damage. Once per day, the wielder can cast the 'Shatter' spell (DC 15) centered on a point they can see within 60 feet.

Lore: Forged in Demacia's ancient foundries, Plated Steelcaps are a staple for soldiers on the front lines. Imbued with magic to withstand both physical and arcane assaults, they symbolize Demacian resilience and unwavering resolve in the face of any foe. Stomping the ground with these boots can send foes flying.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. In addition, you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed. As a bonus action, you can stomp the ground, creating a shockwave in a 15-foot radius centered on yourself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Lore: A prized possession among Bilgewater captains and merchants, the Port Pad offers a quick escape or strategic redeployment. Activating the pad teleports a vessel to a pre-determined location, making it invaluable for navigating dangerous waters or outmaneuvering rivals in the cutthroat world of the Serpent Isles. Its destinations are known only to the Pad's owner.
DescriptionLore: This small, intricately carved pad allows for near-instantaneous teleportation of seagoing vessels. As an action, you can touch the pad to a ship of Large size or smaller. That ship, along with all creatures and objects aboard, instantly teleports to a predetermined location associated with this pad. The destination must be within 500 miles and a known, fixed location you have visited previously. The Port Pad can only be used once per day, and its destination can be changed by performing a 24-hour ritual at the desired new location.

Lore: Adorned with sun-baked gold and etched with ancient Shuriman glyphs, the Prospector's Ring guides seekers through treacherous sands and forgotten ruins. It whispers secrets of hidden passages and forgotten treasures, remnants of a bygone era when the Ascended ruled the desert empire. Some rings are said to hold dormant powers waiting to be awakened.
DescriptionLore: This ring, crafted from sun-baked gold and etched with ancient Shuriman glyphs, grants its wearer advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to navigate deserts and Wisdom (Perception) checks to locate hidden doors, traps, and passages within ruins and tombs. Additionally, once per day, the wearer can cast the Locate Object spell, requiring no components, to find a specific object made of metal or stone within 1 mile. If the ring belonged to an Ascended, it might possess additional, yet dormant, powers waiting to be unlocked.

Lore: A marvel of Piltovan engineering, the Rapid Firecannon supercharges ranged weaponry. Its precisely calibrated capacitors store energy, allowing marksmen to deliver shots with unparalleled speed and devastating impact.
DescriptionLore: This exquisitely crafted longbow hums with latent energy. When you make a ranged attack with this weapon, the bowstring vibrates, enhancing the shot's power. The bow has a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can focus its energy, causing your next successful ranged attack with it to have its range doubled and deal an extra 2d6 lightning damage.

Lore: Brewed by Ionian monks using techniques passed down through generations, this potion is said to accelerate the body's natural healing processes and bolster resistance to ailments. Its gentle aroma evokes the tranquility of the spirit blossoms.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this potion, you regain 8d4 hit points. For the next hour, you gain advantage on saving throws against disease and poison, and your exhaustion level, if any, is decreased by one.

Lore: A shard of celestial power, perhaps fallen from a Targonian Aspect or their blessed warriors. Holding it channels raw starlight, granting a surge of strength and bolstering one's presence with otherworldly grace. Use with caution, for the mountain's power is immense.
DescriptionLore: While holding this amulet, you gain a +2 bonus to Strength and Charisma checks and saving throws. Additionally, you can use a bonus action to call upon the celestial power within, granting you advantage on attack rolls for 1 minute. Once this bonus action is used, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: An amulet resonating with latent spirit energy. It amplifies spells with a concussive force, imbuing them with echoes of thunder that shock the target. Some say it whispers secrets of forgotten spirit magic to its wearer.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this amulet, the first time you cast a spell of 1st level or higher on each of your turns, one target of the spell takes an extra 1d6 thunder damage. This damage increases to 2d6 if the spell requires an attack roll and the attack roll is a critical hit.

Lore: An ancient Noxian scroll detailing a forbidden hemomantic ritual. The Rite of Ruin allows the user to sacrifice life essence for dark power, whether to mend wounds, inflict grievous harm, conjure blood constructs, or empower weapons with necrotic energy. Few dare tread this path.
DescriptionLore: This ancient Noxian scroll contains a powerful ritual of hemomancy. When cast, using a willing or incapacitated creature, you can sacrifice up to 6 hit dice from it. For each hit die sacrificed, the ritual's cast time is increased by 10 minutes. Choose one of the following effects: Restore hit points to yourself equal to the maximum value of the die; Instantly deal necrotic damage to a creature within 60 feet equal to double the maximum value of the die; Create a blood construct with hit points equal to 5 times the maximum value of the die that obeys your commands for 30 days; Enhance your weapon attacks with necrotic energy, dealing an extra 1d6 necrotic damage per sacrificed hit die for 1 year.

Lore: Forged by Ionian spirit walkers, the Runeglaive channels the flow of vital energy. It is a symbol of balance, blending martial skill with arcane understanding, embodying the harmony sought by the Kinkou Order. Those who wield it walk the line between spirit and steel.
DescriptionLore: This exquisitely crafted glaive hums with Ionian spirit energy. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Additionally, once per day, as a bonus action, you can imbue the glaive with arcane power for 1 minute. While imbued, the glaive deals an extra 2d6 radiant damage on a hit, and you can use your action to unleash a wave of spirit energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Undead and fiends have disadvantage on this saving throw.

Lore: Etched with ancient runes, this compass guides its bearer to sources of potent elemental magic. Some say it was crafted by the Iceborn before their civilization was buried under the glaciers by the Watchers, allowing them to track the flow of raw magic across the Freljord.
DescriptionLore: This ancient compass, etched with Freljordian runes, always points towards the nearest source of powerful elemental magic. The compass has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. As an action, you can expend a charge and ask the compass a question related to finding a specific location or object imbued with elemental power. The compass will then guide you towards the answer for the next hour, granting you advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track or navigate towards the source. Furthermore, while holding the compass, you are resistant to cold damage and have advantage on saving throws against being lost or disoriented due to magical effects.

Lore: A relic blessed by the celestial Aspect of the Protector, Salvation emanates a comforting aura. It's said to have been gifted to mortals to aid those who selflessly safeguard the innocent, embodying the virtue of selfless sacrifice in the face of overwhelming darkness.

Born amidst the volcanic vents beneath the Frostguard Citadel, Scorchclaw Pups are miniature manifestations of fiery resilience. Their burning claws are a testament to the raw, untamed power that slumbers beneath the icy surface of the Freljord.

More than a simple chair, the Seat of Command embodies Noxian authority. Forged from black iron mined from the Immortal Bastion, it is bestowed upon commanders who demonstrate unwavering strategic brilliance and the iron will to secure victory for Noxus, no matter the cost.

A dagger favored by Bilgewater's bounty hunters. Its design, inspired by the sea's most venomous creatures, ensures no shield can withstand its bite. It strips away magical defenses with ruthless efficiency.
DescriptionLore: This dagger grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. On a hit, if the target has a magical shield or barrier active (such as from the Shield spell or a similar effect), that effect is immediately dispelled. Additionally, the target has disadvantage on saving throws against spells for 1 minute.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, this armguard whispers of a fallen warlord. It offers resilience against both blade and mind, but demands a heavy toll. Wearer beware, for its power comes at the cost of your very being.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this armguard, you gain a +2 bonus to AC and advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. However, at the end of each long rest, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion. This item is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the armguard.

Lore: Forged by the Solari during a desperate age, Shurelya's Requiem amplifies the wielder's will into a wave of inspiring speed. It echoes with the faith and determination of those who faced insurmountable odds.
DescriptionLore: While holding this amulet, you can use an action to grant yourself and all allies within 30 feet a burst of speed. For the next minute, each affected creature's movement speed is doubled, and they gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws. Once used, this property of the amulet cannot be used again until the next dawn. Additionally, while attuned to this amulet, you gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

Lore: A fragment of Mount Targon, imbued with celestial light. The Sightstone pierces the veil, revealing hidden truths and forgotten paths. It grants vision beyond mortal limits, whispering secrets to those who seek them.
DescriptionLore: This smooth, milky stone pulses with a faint, inner light.
