While holding the Sightstone, you can cast the 'Detect Magic' spell at will, and you gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks relying on sight within 30 feet. As an action, you can expend a charge (recharges 1d4-1 charges at dawn) to cast the 'Clairvoyance' spell, requiring no material components. The stone emits dim light in a 5-foot radius while in use.

Lore: Crafted by an Ionian hedge wizard, these boots grant a fleeting burst of incredible speed. Perfected for nimble students and swift warriors, they allow one to strike with unmatched precision after a rapid advance.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these supple leather boots, your walking speed increases by 5 feet. Once per short rest, as a bonus action, you can activate the boots to double your walking speed until the end of your turn. If you move at least 20 feet in a straight line using this doubled speed, you can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against a creature within range at the end of your movement.

Lore: Forged in the depths of the Shadow Isles, this anchor binds wayward souls. Its chilling presence disrupts the undead, hindering their advance and offering a glimmer of respite amidst the Ruination's eternal sorrow. Legends whisper of its ability to tether even the most tormented spirits.
DescriptionLore: This heavy, iron anchor radiates a chilling aura. While holding it, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As an action, you can slam the Soul Anchor into the ground. For the next minute, all undead creatures within 30 feet of the anchor have disadvantage on attack rolls and must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw to move more than 10 feet away from the anchor on their turn. Once this property is used, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: A tool of spectral harvest, this sickle whispers promises of power from beyond the veil. Wielded by those who dare to manipulate life's fragile thread, it reaps souls, trapping them in eternal servitude, or offering a fleeting surge of strength to its wielder, a dark pact with the Isles.
DescriptionLore: This sickle, when wielded against an undead creature, deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. Additionally, once per long rest, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this sickle, you can choose to trap its soul. The creature cannot be resurrected except by a wish spell or similar magic, and you gain advantage on one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw within the next hour.

Lore: Forged in the underbelly of Zaun, this blade amplifies arcane malice. Alchemically treated to siphon magical energies, it leaves its wielder empowered, while their target struggles against the increased potency of subsequent spells. A favored tool among Zaun's rogue mages.
DescriptionLore: While holding this dagger, whenever you cast a spell that deals damage, you can choose one creature damaged by the spell to suffer disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the start of your next turn. Additionally, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC.

Lore: Woven with spirit threads from ancient Ionian forests, this visage shields against the shadows and enhances the body's natural resilience. It bolsters the mind against fear and the soul against corruption, empowering the wearer's life force and drawing power from their spirit realm.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this mask, you have resistance to necrotic damage and you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, whenever you regain hit points from a spell or magical effect, you regain additional hit points equal to 1d6. This bonus increases to 2d6 if you are in your own plane of existence.

Lore: A relic of House Stark, a fallen Noxian family known for their ruthless conquest, this warhammer embodies brutal efficiency. It grants unparalleled strength, driving enemies into submission and instilling fear in those who dare oppose Noxus' might, a dark echo of a house consumed by its own ambition.
DescriptionLore: This Noxian warhammer was forged for the Stark family. While wielding this hammer, you gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. In addition, when you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of your next turn. Once per long rest, as a bonus action, you can unleash a wave of raw aggression, granting yourself advantage on all attack rolls until the end of your next turn and enemies within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

Lore: Whispers tell of a staff that amplifies celestial power, sought by those who channel the storm. Some believe it resonates with the raw energy of the Aspects, capable of unleashing devastating lightning.
DescriptionLore: This Targon-forged staff crackles with celestial energy. You gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. Once per day, as an action, you can cast Chain Lightning (8th level) without expending a spell slot. After casting Chain Lightning in this way, roll a d6. On a 1, the staff loses its magic and becomes a nonmagical quarterstaff.

Lore: Forged in the heart of a cosmic alignment, Syzygy pulses with the light of dying stars. A weapon favored by the faithful, it can unleash a blinding burst of celestial energy.
DescriptionLore: This radiant longsword pulses with starlight. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. As an action, you can unleash a burst of celestial energy, forcing each creature within 15 feet of you to make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d6 radiant damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: A clinging horror from the Shadow Isles, this parasite hungers for life. It offers protection from mental assault, but demands a terrible price, twisting its host into a husk that only the undead can stomach.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this item, you are immune to being charmed or possessed. Additionally, as an action, you can attempt to drain the life force of a creature within 5 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 3d6 necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. While attuned, you have disadvantage on all Charisma checks not directed at undead.

Lore: A relic of the Frostguard, this dagger whispers of forgotten winters. Its chill still bites, capable of freezing enemies in their tracks, a shadow of the power it once held under the Ice Witch's command.
DescriptionLore: This dagger is a relic of a bygone age, radiating a faint chill. While holding the dagger, you have resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to unleash a burst of frost. Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating from you must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 2d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails this save also has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn. The dagger has 3 charges, and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: A remnant of a bygone celestial age, this talisman offers resilience and protection. In moments of near-death, it calls upon the stars for aid, a beacon of hope in the darkest hour. It wards off fear.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this talisman, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC and saving throws. Once per long rest, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to be healed for 2d8 + your Wisdom modifier hit points instead. If you do, a beam of faint starlight descends upon you from the heavens. Additionally, you gain advantage on saving throws against being frightened while you are at or above half of your maximum hit points.

Lore: A carefully measured draught, rumored to be distilled from Spirit Blossom petals under a waxing moon. It offers fleeting clarity and power, allowing the imbiber to briefly reclaim lost magical potential and resist mental assaults. But be warned, such borrowed strength takes its toll.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this elixir, you regain one expended spell slot. The spell slot can be of 3rd level or lower. The elixir has no effect if you have no expended spell slots. For the next hour, you have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against spells and magical effects. After 1 hour, you suffer one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Woven with ancient Ionian spirit weaving techniques and imbued with elemental energies, this weapon amplifies the wielder's connection to their inner power. Striking with it allows one to channel their life force, inflicting devastating blows and mending grievous wounds.
DescriptionLore: This magical weapon grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend 3 ki points to deal an extra 3d10 force damage to the target and regain hit points equal to the force damage dealt. You can only use this ability once per turn.

Lore: A volatile concoction of Hextech ingenuity and Zaunite chemicals, this device crackles with unpredictable energy. It offers a range of destructive capabilities, from searing lightning to choking toxins, but its unrefined nature makes it a dangerous gamble even for its user.
DescriptionLore: This device has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend one charge to unleash a burst of energy, creating one of the following effects: 1) Fire a beam that deals 8d6 lightning damage in a 60-foot line, 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking half damage on a success. 2) Release a cloud of noxious gas in a 20-foot radius. Each creature in the cloud must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. 3) Unleash a wave of concussive force, pushing all creatures within 15 feet of you 15 feet away. Creatures must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. The device regains 1d3 charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Legends whisper of a tempestuous wind spirit bound within this weapon by the Kohong Order. It grants the wielder unnatural speed and agility, allowing them to dance through danger and summon protective whirlwinds, though at the cost of straining the bond between spirit and steel.
DescriptionLore: While wielding Typhoon, you gain the following benefits: Your speed increases by 30 feet. You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws. As a bonus action, you can summon a whirlwind in a 10-foot radius around you. Creatures within the whirlwind have disadvantage on ranged attack rolls. The whirlwind lasts for 1 minute or until you dismiss it as a bonus action. Once you use this bonus action, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: A marvel of Targon's Solari artisans, this aeropack allows wearers to emulate the grace of celestial beings. It grants the freedom of flight and the ability to soften even the highest of falls. With bursts of enhanced power, it allows a brief connection to the cosmic winds.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this aeropack, you gain a flying speed of 60 feet. Additionally, you can cast the Feather Fall spell at will. As an action, you can activate the aeropack's enhanced thrusters, granting you a flying speed of 120 feet and the ability to hover for 1 minute. After using the enhanced thrusters, the aeropack requires 1 hour to recharge.

Lore: Forged by Demacian artisans to defend against rogue mages and the encroaching Void. It instills unwavering courage against magical threats, a bulwark against corruption.
DescriptionLore: While holding this shield, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. As a reaction when you or a creature within 30 feet of you is targeted by a spell, you can expend 1 of the shield's 3 charges to grant the target advantage on the saving throw against the spell. The shield regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Favored by Demacian scouts and the Dauntless Vanguard, this enchanted stone pierces through shadows and illusions. It stands as a silent sentinel, guarding against ambush and deceit.
DescriptionLore: This small, magically-infused stone can be planted as an action. It emits bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet. While active, the ward grants advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to detect invisible or obscured creatures and objects within its radius. The ward has AC 10, 1 hit point, and is immune to poison and psychic damage. It lasts for 8 hours or until destroyed. A creature can use its action to make a DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana) check to dispel the ward early.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, this weapon embodies relentless aggression. It amplifies martial prowess, empowering its wielder to dominate the battlefield through sheer force.
DescriptionLore: This weapon pulses with barely contained rage. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, when you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. On a failed save, you can immediately make one additional weapon attack against the prone target as a reaction.

Lore: A brutal weapon steeped in Noxian darkness, rumored to be stained with the essence of betrayal. It rewards those who spill blood, granting them a morbid vitality.
DescriptionLore: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic hatchet. Once per day, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you can regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus. Also, the first time on each of your turns that you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, the creature takes an extra 1d6 necrotic damage.

Lore: Resonating with the magic of the Iceborn, this amulet grants resilience against the Freljord's biting cold. It allows one to summon the blizzard's fury, a chilling reminder of winter's power.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this amulet, you gain resistance to cold damage. Additionally, you can use an action to summon a blizzard in a 20-foot radius centered on you. The blizzard lasts for 1 minute, lightly obscures the area, and creatures within the blizzard have their movement speed halved. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, this amulet resonates with celestial energy. It whispers of ancient pacts, amplifying the bonds between allies through unspoken blessings, and ensuring that even in the face of death, hope may yet endure.
DescriptionLore: This amulet has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to grant one creature you can see within 30 feet of you the benefits of the *Bless* spell for 1 minute (no concentration required). Additionally, if you or an ally within 30 feet of you is reduced to 0 hit points, you can expend 2 charges as a reaction to instead drop to 1 hit point. The amulet regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Once carried by sentinels patrolling the haunted coasts, Wriggle's Lantern pierces the spectral veil of the Shadow Isles. Its light reveals hidden dangers and offers protection against the encroaching darkness, though its power wanes with each passing year.
DescriptionLore: This lantern sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. While holding the lantern, you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or possessed by undead. As an action, you can target a creature within 60 feet of you that is invisible, ethereal, or shapechanged. That creature must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become visible, corporeal, or revert to its true form for 1 minute. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: Crafted for the most agile of the Kinkou Order, these boots enhance balance and agility. They allow the wearer to remain grounded, even amidst spiritual turmoil or the fiercest physical assault, ensuring they are never truly knocked off course.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, your Dexterity score increases by 2, to a maximum of 22. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against being knocked prone or moved against your will.

Lore: Bound to the spectral essence of Youmuu, a vengeful spirit forever trapped within the Shadow Isles, this blade pulses with restless energy. Unleashing its power grants incredible speed and strength, but at a terrible cost – the encroaching exhaustion of a spirit denied its rest.
DescriptionLore: This spectral blade hums with restless energy. Once per long rest, as a bonus action, you can unleash Youmuu's Wrath for 1 minute. While Youmuu's Wrath is active, your movement speed is doubled, and you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. At the end of Youmuu's Wrath, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Prized by Ionian duelists who value swiftness above all else, Zeal embodies the perfect harmony between speed and precision. It grants the wearer unparalleled agility, allowing them to evade danger and strike with lightning-fast reflexes, a true testament to Ionian martial philosophy.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this item, your base walking speed increases by 10 feet. Additionally, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC and Dexterity saving throws as long as you are not wearing heavy armor or using a shield. As a reaction when you are targeted by a melee attack, you can move up to your speed away from the attacker, negating the attack.

Lore: A relic said to amplify the chilling power of the Freljord. Legend claims it was forged in a forgotten glacial storm, empowering its wielder with the raw force of winter.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this herald, you gain resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can unleash a wave of frost, forcing each creature in a 30-foot cone to make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d8 cold damage and has its speed reduced by half until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't have its speed reduced. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

Lore: A masterpiece of temporal engineering, rumored to be the culmination of Zhonya's life's work. It allows for the brief manipulation of time, a feat that blurs the line between genius and madness.
DescriptionLore: This intricate golden device allows you to briefly manipulate time. As an action, you can activate Zhonya's Paradox, encasing yourself in a temporal stasis for 1 round. During this time, you are petrified, and you are immune to all damage and effects, but you also cannot take any actions, move, or be moved. After the round ends, you return to normal. Once used, Zhonya's Paradox cannot be used again until 7 days have passed.

Lore: A conduit to the Void, pulsating with alien energy from the fallen realm of Icathia. It births strange, chitinous creatures, a chilling reminder of the dangers lurking beyond Runeterra.
DescriptionLore: This fist-sized stone pulsates with otherworldly energy. As an action, you can place the Zz'Rot Portal on any unoccupied space within 10 feet. The portal lasts for 1 minute, or until destroyed (AC 15, 30 hit points, immune to psychic and poison damage). Each round, at the start of your turn, the portal summons 1d3 Voidmites. These creatures are loyal to you and obey your commands. After the portal disappears, it crumbles to dust and cannot be used again.
